text: Some of the most authentic BBQ I've had in Vegas to date. Brisket was by far the best item on the menu. They know what they are doing. BBQ is a tough sell in Las Vegas and I hope they stay put for a long time. Well done!

The food, especially the honey cornbread, is delicious,  and the service is very friendly.  I have to give them a 4 instead of a 5 because they really do need to work on better assessing their raw goodsinventory food-wise. They were almost out of everything by 6 pm on a Saturday night, and they weren't supposed to close until 9pm. That's money down the drain. This isn't the first time that this has happened so once they get a grip on that issue they'll be a 5. I would suggest calling first to see what they've run out of before making the trek in person.
Not my favorite place in town . Sorry not sorry #brysontiller Go to famous faces across the street . Not bad just not my favorite .

This place is small but it definitely has the summerlin feel. High ceilings, floor to crawling window front, very open. Only about 15 tables. Its best if you come with someone so they can hold a table while you order. 

Counter service. They have kids running the food so the guy that dropped off our Mac and cheese had his thumb in it. 

The food is absolutely delicious. I don't particularly enjoy BBQ, but this place has love in their food. We ordered the brisket, sausage, and pulled pork should. The sausage was super tasty but it's a finer ground and I didn't care for the texture. The brisket and the pork shoulder were fall apart tender, juicy and smokey. THAT BARK! It's so serious. Mac and cheese was very good. Breading was too thick on the fried pickles, maybe if they used a larger cut of pickle. Fries weren't anything special. 

They have three different sauces, that you don't need because the meat is delicious, but the hot BBQ was very good. They also had a regular BBQ and a secret white BBQ sauce, it's milk based, I didn't care for it too much. Tasted like sour milk. 

There was one person that was particularly helpful. I believe her name is Adrian. She was very friendly and remembered us from our previous visit.

Have eaten here several times, last night was a disappointment. Our family of three ordered two meat plate (brisket and ribs), pulled pork tacos and pulled pork sandwich.
The pulled pork was extremely dry, no flavor.  Speaking of flavor, what happen to the white barbecue sauce? Two meat plate portion was small, brisket was sliced thin, maybe they were afraid of running out. The baked beans were not quite the same, a little undercooked. Change your vendor for the tortillas, not very fresh. 

Now about the service, constantly had to remind the cashier that there was no forks, as our food was getting cold. No forks, no white sauce, no lemon for my tea and no soft serve ice cream.

Hopefully it was just bad day, will give them another visit.

Maaaan they have to get a bad review because I tried to place an order and they didn't have anything !!!!! 
No ribs
No chicken 
No brisket 
Why are you even open?????

Looking for something different than "Famous 
Dave's" did research and found Billy's.  Went in around 4 PM on Saturday afternoon to pick up menu, never did I have any contact with an employee, but did talk to two different patrons.
Both said to give it a try, so I called at 5:30 to place a "to go order."  It went to voice mail, decided to just go up and order, when I got there at 6 PM was informed that they were pretty much out of everything.  DUH it's Saturday night at 6 PM.  General manager did not seem to be to concerned.  Ended up ordering a pulled pork sandwich with a side of beans, both were only OK, not the ribs I anticipated ordering.  Sorry but don't waste your time on this place it will be broke on out of business shortly because the owner either doesn't care or doesn't know better.

The Service here is fantastic!! The food is amazing and I will most definitely be telling my friends and family to come eat here!

I tried the sampler which includes 1/4 lb. each of pulled chicken, sliced brisket and pulled pork, 4 baby back ribs, 1 sausage, 2 small sides. 

I had lean brisket which is tender, juicy and full of that slow smoked flavor. The Pulled Pork was my second favorite meat, again tender and juicy with a nice flavor. The sausage which is different now than what it used to be is much better in my opinion, more of a smoked sausage than a polish. The RIBS are my favorite and I would say is the Best in Town by far. Fall off the bone tender and smothered in the yummy goodness of the made from scratch BBQ sauce. The chicken is also very delicious but I didn't have very much room left for it after all of the face stuffing of the ribs.

I tried the Bacon Mac n Cheese and was very surprised at how creamy it was but yet had that perfect golden brown cheese bake on top and sprinkled with bacon because you know bacon makes everything better.

Baked Beans are truly a must have here. Bursting with that smoky BBQ flavor but still sweet and heaven in your mouth.

Save the best part for last...the to die for Peach Cobbler. OMG I could seriously eat this every time and the best part is, is that it is Complimentary!!

I absolutely love this place and will be back many more times to come!!

BBQ Fan,
Leslie H

Even though I believe my meal was 5 stars, I'm giving it 3 stars, and here is why: our lunch was "brought in."

We ordered the brisket, pulled pork, mac & cheese, and corn bread. In the large aluminium pans. 

Even though we ordered ahead, by the time we received our order and got it back to our office it was warm-room temp or cold. 

And it was absolutely fantastic!!

Even cold, the brisket & pulled pork was tender, full of flavor, and did not need any sauce to enhance its goodness. The brisket pulled away easily & without effort; the pull pork fell apart. As they should. To me, just like a steak, if you have to add sauce to it, it wasn't good to begin with. 

The mac & cheese, even cold, was a huge pile of creamy goodness on my plate. The pasta was perfect. 
Instant mac this was not. 

Everything was fresh. That it was cold did not disappoint. I had fridge cold leftovers that night...30 seconds in the mike & was perfection!! 

(I wasn't keen on the corn bread. While it had a good sweet flavor, it was dry. But I won't blame Billy's for this-they bring it in from an outside source here in town. I forget the name...)

Born & raised in Texas and having eaten at some of the best BBQ joints in all of Dallas & Ft Worth, I have been searching for a BBQ place to do my taste buds proud since leaving in 1996. It's taken 20 years to find it, and it was worth the search. I only wish I found it sooner. 

Hopefully I can visit Billy's BBQ as a dine in and update my 3-stars to 5.

(It is true, they do run out of meats. Meat for next days service goes in the night before. Once they're out, they're out. I suggest going for lunch so you're bound to get what you want instead of slim pickings for dinner.)

Excellent BBQ! Take your time to carefully consider the menu. You'll either regret not getting something else or will order both and roll out the door. Ribs were the best I every had--pull apart tender. Awesome selection of craft root beers too. Try Brownie's! And they're gun friendly!

Stopped quick for lunch and it was good. I got the Pitmaster samich. The sauces weren't my cup of tea as they're about as thin as water and vinegar based. The "hot" vinegar sauce didn't have any heat at all for me. The original sauce was a bit too sweet for me. The menu looks expensive at first glance but the Pitmaster samich was piled high. It's one of those samiches that spills out after every bite you take so you know they're giving healthy portions. Plus, the meat was juicy and not overly smoked... could even have a little more smoke. I was kinda disappointed in the non-lunch portions. What you order for lunch is the same portion that you order for dinner. So for me the 2-3 meat platter didn't make much sense for lunch being that it also comes with 2 sides. I woulda been extremely unproductive in the afternoon had I eatin the platter! I'd like to see a smaller samich that also comes with a small side for lunch.  For $12 the samich seems a bit spendy for lunch but when you leave you're full. Having said all that, I'm looking forward to going back... it was good, better samich than Famous or Lucille. Small place tho, hope they succeed and move into a bigger place to offer a full restaurant experience with drinks and a cool atmosphere.
Such a treat to find real BBQ! Brisket was some of the best I've had. Friendly staff. New favorite
two words: must try! The food at Billy's BBQ is amazing. Reminds me of home! Good value for your dollar and you get free dessert with your meal!
Yummy and not over priced!  Great staff. Clean place. Tender meat. Not salty. Seasoned well.

This place is SO GOOD! You actually get a lot of meat from the delicious juicy ribs. The mac n cheese with bacon is so good and creamy and made with real bacon bits! The pickle fries were perfect! The cornbread was moist and the butter spread is so yummy. Everything on my plate was great! Highly recommend this place!!!

This place used to be amazing.  It appears that they are under new ownership and still trying to work out a few of the kinks.  Our lunch today was not good, but when we called the new owner was very polite.  We sincerely hope that he can succeed in getting the recipes back on track.  In the meantime, be prepared that your dish may not be the same as you remember.
Hands down the best BBQ I have ever had! The brisket was absolutely amazing! Will for sure be coming back again.

Very good experience!  The brisket ranks with the best I have ever tasted - don't sauce it before you try it, didn't need a drop.  The pulled pork was also flavorful. The staff was very pleasant and helpful.  I shall return....

Oh my gosh!! Billy's is our new favorite BBQ place in Vegas or maybe anywhere!
It's family owned so they are so kind to their customers and give you great deals! The staff are the kind of people who love what they do and LOVE barbecue, so you know you're going to enjoy your meal just from the way they greet you!! We have had the ribs- they are seriously PERFECT! And the brisket is so peppery and my favorite I've had in a while!! I also love the baked beans and Mac and cheese!! 
They have a few different recipes of bbq sauce and my favorite is the Smokey, but the food is so good so you don't have to have it.
I'd recommend Billy's to BBQ enthusiasts and anyone looking for a yummy meal!
The ribs are delicious by far my favorite I also enjoyed the Mac n cheese & the beans the front staff was very friendly I went on Friday morning & everything was great

Awesome street tacos and mac and cheese. I've been here about 5 times and they never disappoint. Their brisket is perfectly cooked and seasoned every time. Only down side is the ice cream machine is never working - lol! Go and enjoy some amazing meat

Pretty good BBQ. Got the three meats combo with Mac and cheese with fries.  Brisket was tender and had great flavor.  The pulled pork was lean but also had great flavor. The sausage was a disappointment. The meat was too finely grounded for my taste. And I didn't particularly care for the seasoning.  In fact, it was kind of like what I imagined dog food would taste like if I were to try dog food.  The sides are not memorable. Overall, it was a nice casual atmosphere.  Also, the vinegar based sauces were good but it didn't wow me.
Brisket was truly excellent. Loved the sides.

Definitely will be back. So far this is my favorite BBQ place in Vegas. I tried there sampler because I needed to sample as much as I could within reason. The shredded meats were ok, but not my favorites. The star was definitely the brisket, flavorful, moist, and had enough delicious fat, that I like! That alone will bring me back. The ribs were pretty good too, but definitely better with there BBQ sauces. Wish they had to go sauces ready, but had to go sauce containers for you to take sauce home. The sausage which I ate the next day was also surprisingly delicious, just wish the casting was not as chewy, but that's just knit picking, it's still fine. And the the sides, the corn bread which came with meal was good and I also had the fried okra, yummy, had some crunch , not soggy okra, plus.
Will be back for a more focused approach!

Went in and tried the pork rib and fatty brisket and it was pretty good. I generally don't care for pork ribs but it literally fell off the bone and was very moist and juicy. The brisket has just enough fat and was very flavorful. 

They had 3 different kinds of bbq sauces sweet, smokey and a white thunder. The sweet is a typical bbq sauce, smokey was my favorite and white thunder was pretty much just heat. 

Prices are pretty much standard to other bbq places starting around $8. Since this is closer to my job I'd definitely go back.

Good pulled pork. Potato salad was delicious. Street tacos are 5 star a must try. Only thing I didn't love was the Mac and cheese but everything else was so good I will definitely be back for more. Best BBQ on the west side of town
Everything was great! Service, food, quantity, pricing and taste. I tried the full rack of ribs, coleslaw and baked beans. Definitely going back.

Way WAY too good. :) the Mac n cheese was cooked perfectly. The ribs were done just right. The sauce was perfect. The slaw is was not too runny. The pulled pork and brisket were cooked just right. The staff were helpful and very nice. It was our first time and we will be back.

I love soul food and BBQ.  I ate at Billy's BBQ with a group of friends today.  I had the ribs and they were tender and moist; the mac and cheese was some of the best I have ever had, and the baked beans have large chunks of meat in it that made the beans out of sight!  I will definitely come back with more friends.

I was a little skeptical about going to this place because of how small it was. After hearing one of my friends constantly talk about this place I decided to drive 30 minutes to see what it was all about. I LOVED IT and can't wait to go back.  The food is so delicious and nothing can really compare to its unique taste. The environment is great also they have football games playing and the employees are patient and kind. Can't wait to go back.

My husband and I frequently patron Billy's BBQ and normally I would rave about how delicious their food is, however, I would NEVER recommend to have them do catering.

We placed a catering order 2 days before an event and were assured our order would be ready to go at 6PM the day of. The day of, we arrive at 6:10 to pick up our food and they don't have it ready. They don't even have anything prepared or sliced. We waited as the kitchen scrambled to pull everything together. It was an absolute circus. They forgot to pack cutlery. We had to remind them. They forgot to pack plates. Again, we had to remind them. After 35 minutes they finally fulfilled our order. 

Having a catering order ready 45 minutes after the initial pick up time is completely unacceptable. The manager in charge never even came out to offer any apologies for their error.

I will never have Billy's cater another event for me.

We got there at 845 so we could not dine in on Sunday because they are closed... But the ribs! To go where excellent!!  My son words these are addicting mom.. We didn't even need the sauce.. The customer service was wonderful even tho it was to go an they were closing... We enjoyed our dinner at home

So... went to Billy's for the fourth time today - actually fifth but apparently they are closed on Sundays. What restaurant that wants to stay in business is closed on Sundays? Disappointing. 
The last two times things were only ok. Not really up to the bar they set the first time. Disappointing.
Today they baked beans were not anywhere close to as good as on our first visit. They tasted like canned pork n beans with a little brisket meat and onion added. There was none of the delicious smoky flavor that was so good the first time. I don't remember onions the first time either. There was also way more meat in the mix on the first visit. Really disappointing. 
The pulled pork was overcooked. The pulled chicken was overcooked. The ribs and brisket were ok. 
The really outstanding recipe at Billy's was the baked beans. Today it was not outstanding. It was weak. It seems that there is a recipe consistency issue. 
What's the deal guys? If you want to keep the doors open, you really need to step it up and be flawlessly consistent. Sorry guys, today was a swing and a miss - a big miss. Kinda sounds like 3 strikes to me. 
Really, really disappointing.

I ended up in Vegas because of the military, I've been INCREDIBLY disappointed with the BBQ in this City.  Billy's has filled the void. I'm from Texas, so BBQ is a BIG BIG deal for me.

MEAT- So far I've tried the sausage, pulled pork, and the brisket.  Most places either over season or smother the meat in sauce. Billy's allows the meat to talk for itself.  Billy's meats don't have a heavy smoke taste. The brisket was incredibly tender with just enough fat that adds to the taste.  One thing that stands out is how much of the natural juice stays in the meat. One problem I've found in Vegas is that none of the meat is tender and juicy.  The meat at Billy's literally falls apart from being so tender.  The sausage has a hint of heat, but nothing to mask the natural flavor.

SAUCE- While Billy's doesnt sauce the meat, they do offer 3 different sauces that you can add on your own.  I only tried the smokey and the hot.  They appear to have a white sauce which I am only guessing is a vinegar based sauce.  Billy recommended it to another customer for the pulled pork.  Both the Smokey and the hot are light in texture so it soaks into the meat without changing any texture. Both sauces are incredibly subtle, which I think is once again goes along with letting the meat do the talking. Being from Texas I'm usually a dry rub guy, but the sauce doesnt mask the taste of the meat

SIDES- I had the pickle fries/ fries/ and pork and beans. The pickle fries are amazing. Nice and crisp and they don't fall apart. The fries were waffle fries, which is always a ++.  The pork and beans were amazing. Nice chunks of pork inside.

TACOS- I had the chicken tacos and an brisket tacos on a separate night. They are street tacos that you can add coleslaw to.  Let me start off by saying I have HATED coleslaw since I was a kid.  I just have never understood the point.  I decided to be brave and try it one the tacos.  OMG......... The sauce in the coleslaw is AMAZING.  The pepper taste completely transformed the taco.  Once again, the chicken and brisket were incredibly tender.  They used corn tortilla, which is the best way to make a taco.

SERVICE- The first night i came in i didn't know what time they closed. I puttered in at 815 only to realize that they closed at 8pm...... The staff was more than happy to welcome me in and remain patient while I asked them about the menu.  The cooks were tossing me suggestions through the window while the cashier was more than happy to allow me to ramble about my love for BBQ.  The second time, Billy was there and was also willing to let me ramble about BBQ.

This is my favorite BBQ restaurant in Las Vegas. The ribs are amazing, the chicken tacos are fantastic, and the barbecue sauces are all very flavorful. 

The service is excellent, quick, and superior compared to other similar restaurants in the Las Vegas area. 

There is a variety of BBQ items at a reasonable cost. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Stopped in on my way home because my usual bbq place was too far out of my way that day.  Was greeted at the counter by an apathetic teenager with "what can I get you? " 
  Had the pulled pork sandwich and smoked mac and cheese.  The pulled pork wasn't cold but wasn't hot by any definition. It had no smoke flavor or any other flavor from any type of dry rub. Just tasted like plain roast pork.  The slaw was dry and bland, basically shredded cabbage with a little black pepper.  Bottom bun was stale.  The smoked mac and cheese (a 4 oz cup) also had no smoke flavor and not cheesy.  It tasted like undercooked pasta from unsalted water tossed in hot milk.  And my bill was $15+!  All in all, very disappointed.  I'm in the food business, have traveled extensively and I've visited all the meccas of BBQ- Austin, K.C., Memphis, Raleigh and Charlotte.   If you do BBQ at home and your friends tell you how good it is and none of you have ever been a legit pit  master or restaurant owner, don't open a BBQ joint.

Amazing food.. Great service!!! 
We had the sampler platter which had four types of meats and four sides.   The brisket was delicious and had a great flavor without bbq sauce.  The chicken was great,  and the sausage was a spicy and good.   The Mac and cheese was super cheesy and delicious.  I also loved the potato salad (and I usually don't like potato salad).   This is a great value and a lot of food for two people to share.   We had the cornbread poppers for desert -  just the right amount of sweetness...  Highly recommend you try them.   They also offer free soft serve ice cream for desert.  Great food and great service at a very affordable price.   You should definitely check them out!

It's ABOUT TIME.   I'm tired of settling for subpar BBQ in Vegas.  It's crazy, Vegas is supposed to be a culinary oasis yet the BBQ here has been lame.  FINALLY we've got some legit meat to talk about.

The brisket here is unreal.  Big, beefy, smokey, and so tender it almost falls apart.  It is HARD to cook brisket like that.  I've owned a smoker for years and smoke meat frequently enough to know how long it takes to cook a brisket like Billy's.

The pulled pork is also amazing whether on the hog heaven sandwich or the pork tacos.  The bark is great, and the flavor is perfect.

Seriously everything here is fantastic -- the pickle fries, the smokey mac n cheese (with Bacon), the cole slaw.

Get off your butts y'all and go check this place out.

So this is the second time we're here. The first time we came 20 min before they closed so I didn't want to write how the owner seems like he didn't want to be there. The other servers and food made up for it. The server told us to come around 4 ish next time. 

So this visit was great. We've now tried everything on the menu and I hate brisket but it's great here. The beans are full of meat. The corn bread is sweet and not dry. The tacos are perfectly filling and the gut busters full of meAt and the white sauce is so good. They also give free ice cream after your meal. Also I saw a sign that said pickle fries and we asked for some and they gave it free of charge. They were perfectly crispy not soggy at all. 

The server today was so friendly. Not sure what his name is but he was the cherry on top. Definitely come here for juicy tasty bbq and great service. And the prices are great!
They catered our New Years Eve party. Very generous portions. Everyone loved the food. Excellent meats and flavor. We'll be back. Great job. Thank you Billy!

Man O Man!!! If you're looking for some amazing BBQ, this is the spot! We've always been super picky about where we get BBQ, and have only found a few places (out of town) that we've enjoyed! One of the owners- Justin is doing it up right! The pastrami is amazing, the ribs just fall off the bone, and the BBQ sauce is a little bit sweet, with a little tang with just the right heat! 
We've been back 3+ times in the last 3 weeks! 
Billy's BBQ is the place to be!

This review is based on delivery via Grubb Hub....I ordered the 3 meat combo, the brisket was good and fatty, the pulled pork was a bit on the dry side, and the sausage was good.  I loved the bacon mac n cheese, very creamy and the cold slaw was good and tangy.  The cornbread ate like a desert a bit sweet to counter the salty BBQ.  It was a lot of food for the money.  My only real concern was the grease on the bottom of the delivery container and the lack of BBQ sauce, I think the pulled pork cold have used sauce...oh, wet wipes and utensils would have been nice too.

Best , Best , Best BBQ EVER !
 SO far i try the ribs ( best ribs i ever ate tender, tasty, finger licking ) ,  gut buster , i think that is how they call it :D:D ( chicken with waffle fries and cheese souse yummmy  :)  and i also recommend Banana Pudding . Yesterday the boy that took my order  , he was very nice and recommend the brisket  and they also  were delicious . :))  Good job ! 
I'M RECOMMEND THIS BBQ PLACE TO EVERY ONE .

This is the best BBQ I have ever eaten in Vegas hands down. I've lived here for years and have tried plenty of restaurants all over the Vegas valley and have no problem bragging about the awesome food here. The staff is more then great offering customer service.

Sitting outside your restaurant and just shaking my head that I just threw away $12

 I ordered the Gut Buster with no Sour Cream. It arrived at the table about 10 minutes after placing the order. A few minutes later a server asked me how it was? I told her the food was barely warm. She offered to replace it and I said ok. After another short wait the replacement was brought out with this white stuff all over the top and I asked what it was? She said it was your white sauce and I told her this is not what I ordered. Now I attempting to eat the stone cold original meal with mushy fries. Threw away most of it just plain awful. 

 On top of it your manager did not even come out to say anything. I went back to the counter before leaving and asked where on the menu does it state white sauce and as you already know it does not. If the manager had come out to speak with me and say the cook prepared the order incorrectly and was sorry but Adriene was back in the kitchen and even after coming to counter and she saw me still not take the time out come to the counter as I told the server who took the order that I was upset and wanted to speak with the owner I was told I could not have his number or email, so here I am posting on Social Media. Billy's at least owes me a refund.

Tip, get here before 6pm otherwise they run out of what you want. Service is awkward as there are no numbers or names on the dine in receipts, basically the cook tells the cashier to go ask everybody what they ordered as they kept screwing things up. 

I ordered a full rack of ribs with mac n cheese and sweet potato fries. I got a half rack with okra and beans. I told them this is someone else's order so someone else could get their food. They offered to substitute another meat "for free" to replace my other half rack of ribs. Um, I paid for a full rack, how is giving a replacement for free when I never got what I paid for in the first place? I was ready to just ask for a refund, but the brisket came out and it was so good and tender that it made me shut up. Then they brought out the correct sides and said we could keep the other 2 that we didn't order. Ok, so now i got my food and i better eat it too. 


The bbq sauces are delicious, who needs ketchup anymore?


The ice cream machine is broken and no longer there, but the old ice cream cones are still behind the counter. I hope they aren't saving them for when they get a new ice cream machine. 


Tip to management, maybe have numbers or customer names to the orders so it's easier to keep track of?

Best bbq I've had yet in Vegas. Brisket fatty and juicy, baby back ribs wonderful, sausage & pulled pork on point .. tasty sides and an array of sauces .. modern and clean atmosphere .. two tv's with games on

Not sure I really want to give this place 5 starts.  IF too many of us let the secret out on how good it is, then the place will always be PACKED!

I had driven by this place once going to Target and thought,  that maybe I should put it in the back of my mind and try someday.  A couple of days later, I saw some posts on FB RAVING about it, so I mentioned it to a co-worker who is a foodie and in search of a great Q place.

Both of us then got a craving for Q especially after my co-worker checked out the Yelp reviews.

I had the 2 piece meat meal. I chose the brisket strips and pulled chicken with beans and corn bread as my sides.  It was OUTSTANDING.  As others have mentioned, you add sauce yourself.  The white thunder sauce was my favorite, but and the other sauce I tried, smokey, were flavorful.

Billy even went around to the customers to see how their meals were.

Take it from a southerner who knows good BBQ ... this is the place for ribs. The brisket baked beans are out of this world.  Trust me ... BBQ places have to earn my rating ... and this one does it hands down.

Well dang. I ate to much. 
I got pulled pork and hubby got brisket. Both are amazing. Collard greens were tasty but I'm from Alabama and we like our greens with pepper sauce.,, this being soul food that is the only reason not 5 star review!!! Get pepper sauce!!! Trust me!!!!
Pickle fries ... Awesome!!! Deviled eggs great!!! Offered us free cobbler and I was scared cause Like I said I'm from Alabama and cobbler has to be on point!!! This was!!!! Amazing., will be back!!

This was great the first couple of times but has gone downhill every one after. The freshness of items seemed to drop as time went by.  It is still decent but not as spectacular as it was on the first couple of visits. Probably not coincidentally, the owner was there the first two tries and I have not seen him since.

We made what would be our first and last visit to Billys.  For a place the advertises "Real Smoke....Real Flavor"  we found neither.  We got there about noon, and hour after they open, only to be told there no ribs ready, and there would be any for another hour.  There was also no corn bread, seems their "supplier" didn't deliver.   We made our choices, my wife had the Pitmaster and fries and I had the three tacos, one each of brisket, chicken and pork, and I had the mac and cheese with bacon.  The meats, for either of us, had no flavor and had to be  drenched in bbq sauce to gain any flavor.  The mac and cheese was a bit of a mystery.  How do you make bacon mac and cheese that had bacon flavor but no actual bacon.  The cole slaw tasted like nothing more than cabbage and watery mayo.

I've eaten here 4 times now and Billy's is some of the best BBQ I've ever had anywhere in the US...and I've eaten alot of BBQ. 

The service is outstanding and Billy's passion for his food really comes across in the food itself and his interaction with guests. 

The brisket is some of the best brisket I've ever had. Well done.
Simply put, the best Brisket and Sausages in town!  Heck even better than many places in Texas!!!  I just wish they had Beef Ribs!  Great place with modern décor and very clean.

Not what it was when it opened. Couldn't taste the smoke. Brisket was tender and moist. Mac and Cheese wasn't close to the original. Flavors have dropped a bit.
The portion size was very good. Cobbler was good. If you are into Carolina BBQ, you'll love this place. They have a really good vinegar sauce that goes well with the meat!
Service was great and quick. Place was a bit empty but staff was great!
My rating is a reflection of Billy's today compared to what it was when it first opened and also based off other BBQ places in the City. I love strong smoky flavors in my BBQ while other people don't at all.
For me there is now better in town. But for others, this could be the place. If you haven't tried it, give it a try. If you haven't been in a awhile, it has changed. Be prepared and come open minded.

Got the sampler platter. Had to get more brisket because they were out of sausage. Not a bad thing because their brisket was awesome! The added chicken and pulled pork were really salty.. like puckered lips salty. The ribs were good just also a lil salty. Not add bad as the last meat stated. The pickle fries were awesome. And the mac and cheese were good. Overall not bad. Corn bread super good!!! With honey butter! Yum.

Billy's BBQ is the real deal.  Just ate the pitmaster sandwich and the pulled pork taco.  Best BBQ in town.  Brisket had great smoke flavor and the right amount of fatty goodness and flavor.  The pulled pork taco was a great changeup to the typical BBQ.  

If in Summerlin you have to hit up this place.  Portion sizes are large, staff is friendly, and easily the best BBQ in town!

I like to think there was two stages in my life, before Billy's and after Billy's. This bbq has changed what I knew about real BBQ. 

Side of the month was fried pickles, these complimented the bbq. But next time I'm gonna just have more meat as my side.

Stopped in here the other day and this place blew my mind! The ribs were incredible and the meat fell right off the bone!
On top of that, the service was amazing. The staff was super informative and brought us cherry and chocolate cobbler. My mouth is watering again thinking about it! I can't wait to go back on Sunday for all you can eat meats!

I had a 2-meat combo and it was excellent. No weak link with what I ordered. I'm looking forward to coming back again. There's pride in the quality of food they serve. I like the Q at the Road Kill Grill a lot in the NW as well, but the wait and long lines there are often problematic. Every other place in town that I've tried doesn't serve bbq as delicious as these two places and that includes nearly everywhere on the Strip.

Excellent BBQ. Hubbie and I shared a 3 meat plate with pulled pork, brisket, and ribs. All three were excellent. Ribs had a great flavored rub. Pulled pork was nice and moist. Brisket had a nice smokey flavor.  BBQ sauces were all great. Owner was very friendly. We will be back!

Got brisket and chicken combo absolutely fantastic! !  Best smoked chicken we have ever had.  Brisket the since Texas. This real deal barbecue.  Disappointed they were out of ribs and pork but if the brisket and chicken are any indication they would have been great also.  I enjoyed the cornbread, yes it is more cake like. Homemade mac and cheese ok. Cole slaw so so for me 
If you can get to the west side of town GO!

I picked up some food for a buddy of mine and myself and I got the two meat plate with baked beans, collard greens, pulled pork and brisket. Also got some peach cobbler. 1st I'll start with the negatives: they were out of root beer, and macaroni and cheese, and the pulled pork looked pretty dry. For someone who has been in the food industry for nearly 30 years, we know we can't please everyone, because they were raised to think and eat differently, and our taste buds mutate every seven years. But common sense weighs in that their selection of root beers must be flying off the shelves and a mad crowd came in and cleaned out their macaroni. Now, I could go to albertsons and pick up up some ingredients to whip up a batch in 20 minutes but the integrity of the dish can be compromised. So good call, chef. I'll gladly wait for a serving next time. But the baked beans and the collard greens were phenomenal. I made a meal out of those and some crinkle cut fries. By the way, skinny fries DOES go better with bbq dishes but crinkle cuts are my favorite also. Keep doing what your doing. The pulled pork....well, I put some bbq sauce that they graciously set on the side for me and as I tossed it and wedged in between the dinner roll provided, it was tender and juicy and tasty. My taste buds had changed at least 5 times by now and for now, I love this place. Famous daves has something to worry about. There were a couple of other tender juicy items I would've like to spoon off my plate, but I'll save that for when I come to try that Mac n cheese. Bravo!

TL;DR version: nothing is seasoned (meat or sides) but all the meats were cooked very well, so somebody knows how to control the heat. I wouldn't call it BBQ because nothing has any flavor and BBQ isn't just about how meat is heated to cook, but how it's rubbed, marinated, mopped, basted, smoked...FLAVORED. The only flavor I got tonight was salt from the food and major sugar from the sauces. The bright spot of the night were the pickle fries, which despite the rest of the food were absolutely delicious. Overall, this place is definitely a no-go. Details follow.


My food had no seasoning other than salt, if anything. My brisket taco was incredibly salty and the corn tortillas tasted super cheap, but the meat had great texture and bark and was cooked well. I couldn't taste any flavor at all from the taco's coleslaw over the meat's salt, so it was basically totally flavorless. Great size though, for its price I'd order these in a heartbeat if they tasted good. My french fries tasted like cheap frozen fries cooked in old oil. My pulled chicken was cooked very well also, but seasoned with only salt as far as I could tell. It seemed like it was made to be eaten with the sauces, but all the sauces were disgusting (more on that in a minute).

The wife's pulled pork had great texture like my pulled chicken, but was again basically unseasoned, and just had salt and cooked alright. However I did get one bite that was all bark (which was pretty thin) and it tasted like pure salt; I had to spit it out. The brisket had good texture and one end of the cut was seasoned but as she worked down the piece of meat the seasoning faded to nothing about halfway through and the second half was unseasoned. Her side of coleslaw also had no flavor at all.

Pickle fries were absolutely excellent. Simple as that. Pickles had snap and tasted fresh. Breading was great thickness and cooked perfectly. We asked for some ranch to go with them, and the ranch they gave us was definitely a store-bought ranch put into those little plastic cups, but they didn't charge us for them and at least it was a good store brand. No complaints on these two items. Easily worth the $2.50.

So about those sauces: original barbecue sauce tasted like ingredients are corn syrup, water, and vinegar (in that order); "hot" barbecue sauce tasted to me just like the original, and was not even remotely spicy (I couldn't tell the difference betwixt the two sauces, truly). Not even my wife thought it was spicy, and she's exceptionally sensitive. White sauce was super watery, even though it was called a mayo-based sauce, and it was short on flavor too. All three sauces were super watery and the two barbecue sauces were super super sweet. I'm not surprised that people are raving about these sauces in some of the reviews. They're basically sugar water, and if you're into eating lots of sugar, then you'll probably like them. But the only flavor they're going to add to the food is sweet, and there's nothing nuanced or subtle or flavorful about it. They have no depth. They are just sugar water.

I felt personally insulted by the menu. $14.99 for 2x 1/4 pound meats, and 2x small sides or one large side. Small sides alone are $2.50, large is $3.50, and 1/2 pound of meat is $7.99. $7.99 + $5 = 1/2 pound of meat and two small sides for $13. So for 2 extra dollars I get the privilege of getting half-and-half meats? OR I could just buy a half pound of meat and the sides on their own and save $3. I thought combo plates were supposed to be a better deal than buying things individually. Apparently not. It's insulting, basically like saying "we think our customers are too stupid to do basic math."

Given all the positive reviews, I'll try this place again and hope they just had an off night with the seasonings. But seriously, it was a really really off night. And I'm pretty sure the menu prices and sauce ingredients were chosen in purpose, no "off night" on that part. Despite the (un)flavor, the meat was all cooked pretty well. It wasn't inedible, that's not my complaint, it's just either super bland or super salty and it's the sauces (or more accurately, sugar waters) that are inedible.

Disrespectful to BBQ everywhere!

Im only giving 1 star because I cannot give fewer.

This place was such a huge disappointment for myself and my boyfriend.

The ribs leave much to be desired. That's putting it mildly. Even though they weren't dry at all, they lacked flavor (and they were smothered in bbq sauce). Ribs are supposed to be seasoned, BBQ sauce should be optional, not the only way to choke them down. There was no smokiness at all, I doubt they had spent any time on an actual grill or in a smoker, you could have even used liquid smoke!!!!
The bbq sauce tasted like it was just poured straight from the bottle.

The sausage.... The sausage tasted like store bought kielbasa sausage. Actually that's disrespectful to store bought kielbasa because even that has more flavor. Not sure I'd even feed this to my dog. It looked like they microwaved it and sliced it into the container.

The baked beans had absolutely no depth in flavor. And the chunks of whatever meat product they use (I think it's supposed to be brisket) cut the inside of my mouth because it was so hard. 

The Mac and cheese was just all around dry. The bacon tasted old, there was an aftertaste.

We read though the reviews on this place and believe that any review for Billy's barbecue that has been rated four stars or better has to be fraudulent, just to boost their score on Yelp and increase sales. This place was empty at 5pm. If you feel that this was good barbecue and you gave it a four star or five star review, you're probably used to the taste of Elmers glue. You're better off spending your money at TGI FRIDAYS.
Will not be back.

Nice little sit down place, great BBQ aromas  when you walk  in, so many choices  to choose from. Slow roasted pork, brisket and chicken  was amazing. Great selection  of root beers,ginger ales and birch  beer. Only thing I wish  they had would be stouts or porters to go with the food. Deff a good spot  for locals!

Strange business. Sells meat by the lb. but not ribs by the rack, have to buy a meal. Sides are sized small or tiny. Can't get pint or quart size for party, have buy lots of small or tiny. Sauce is in 2oz mini selfserve self-fill  containers, asked for a couple of tiny sides containers for sauce was told against the rules. Thank goodness for a sympathetic  cashier who relented.

Sides were non-descript, ribs and brisket were dry, no moisture at all. Even with sauce both were disappointing.

It was expensive, didn't offer platter for parties or families. And was expensive for so so BBQ.

Seems the only decent place in Vegas for BBQ is Roadkill Grill.

A BBQ place that's out of pork and ribs.. Wow.. And it says a 2 meat plate comes with cornbread but I can only get it as one of my sides because they are losing their vender so they give you a small loaf of bread... Smh. Should have just gone to Rollin smoke
Delicious.... Overall great experience. The BBQ pulled pork topped Mac n cheese bowl is out of this world!

Amazing!  Styled as a fast food type restaurant.  Not overly priced, either!  The pulled pork sandwich was tender, moist and very flavorful!  The barbecue baked beans were the best I've ever had!
Awesome!!!!!

Our first visit and very happy we found this gem!! We tried the pickle fries which are some of the best I've tried. We tried the brisket, pulled pork, pulled chicken and the spicy brisket sausage. They were all good but the brisket was spectacular. Hands down the best brisket we have had in Vegas. I also had a brisket taco which was equally good. The sides we tried were the Mac n cheese, fries and baked beans. The beans were the best of the 3 sides but all were good. I look forward to trying the ribs next time!!

I've only been here once, but I must this one time experience was enough for me to say this place has the best bbq in Las Vegas. I myself am from Virginia and I have lived in N.C., and Memphis and have had some of the best bbq through out my travels. Sad to say Vegas has a lot to learn when it comes bbq, and who better to teach them none other than Billy's. Billy's BBQ is how bbq should taste. I've tried the chicken, pork, brisket and they even let me try their shrimp taco which wasn't even on the menu. They even have three different bbq sauces and all three taste phenomenal! I definitely plan on revisiting Billy's in the near future.

It's so hard to find good barbecue in Las Vegas. Meat menu includes shredded pork or chicken, sausage, and my personal favorite, brisket- available three cuts (fatty, lean, or chopped). Prices are fair and portions are large but quality could use a boost.

Opted for the three meat plate to get a good sample of all the products offered. Meats are dry across the board and sparingly seasoned, the brisket was okay- I have had much worse in town. Added on the sausage (more like a hot link) for $3, and it was solid. Combo included two small sides: the mac was overwhelmingly creamy and cheesy while the baked beans were flavorful with bits of brisket. I don't usually care for cornbread but the piece that came with our mean was good, but the accompanying cinnamon-honey butter was amazing! 

Barbecue is one of those foods that can get pricey for a family to eat out, and Billy's has large portions for small prices: the above easily fed two grown adults, for about $22. Tables only seemed to have one unlabeled barbecue sauce, which I assume was the house creation- it was on the sweet side, while I prefer mine with a bit of a kick. 

Service was polite, space is modern and clean, but overall they need to work on the details: season the meats, make sure not to overcook them to dryness, and add more sauces. A partnership with Larry's Western Meats is suggested- their sauce selection is unbeatable.
I'm not much of a BBQ fan, but I thought this place was good, and the staff were very friendly!! I'll definitely be going back.
Service is good but the new menu is disappointing. The Mac and Cheese was too mushy. They also took the corn bread off the menu. Both these items were amazing and are missed.

So DELICIOUS! Heard about this place all the way up in Utah and had to come check it out. Got the 3 meat plate and it was rockin! The chicken and brisket beans were probably the favorite, but it's hard to say cuz I don't think you will go wrong with anything on the menu. Oh yeah, don't pass up the tacos!

Very good and not just for price.  I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich with the baked mac n chz.  The pulled pork is tender and juicy.  The BBQ sauces they offer to put on top are yummy with very original flavor.  The mac n chz was yummy and I love mac n chz. They offered complimentary peach or cherry cobbler. Best peach cobbler I ever had!  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Service is fast.  Definitely returning here.

For a little over a year now, my boyfriend and I have let our weakness for good BBQ get the best of us. Many an evening, we have set out to enjoy a different type of cuisine (Thai, perhaps... or a burger joint) only to be manipulated and circumvented the moment we see a sign for BBQ. What can I say? We just can't resist the smell of wood smoke, roasting meat, and that sweet, sweet sauce. 

This very thing happened to us a few nights ago. We were all set to enjoy a quick burger at Fudruckers, when - lo and behold - I glimpsed the sign for Billy's BBQ, and all of our best laid plans went out the proverbial window. We were helpless against it. As suckers for BBQ, but even bigger suckers for local, independent restaurants, it was meant to be. 

We were greeted the moment we entered by the friendly staff behind the counter. Having never been there before, I asked for the cashier's recommendations -- and I'm so glad I did! She suggested the brisket, the ever popular street tacos, and - if my boyfriend and I were planning to share - the sampler platter. 

As recent transplants to the Las Vegas valley from the NYC area, I was a bit worried about the lack of BBQ in our new home. After all, BBQ is experiencing a renaissance in Manhattan and Brooklyn these days. It's the newest, hottest trend in artisan, gourmet cuisine -- new places popping up everywhere, and lines snaking outside for blocks and blocks. Since we LOVE BBQ, we were thrilled about this, of course, but also devastated to leave it behind. In our travels from old hometown to new, we drove cross country through Kansas City, Oklahoma City, and Texas -- choosing that route precisely because we would be in BBQ Country. I say this just to emphasize my point: we LOVE us some BBQ. 

But back to the sampler platter! It typically comes with a quarter pound of four separate meats: pulled chicken, sliced brisket, pulled pork, 4 baby back ribs, 1 sausage, AND 4 sides. All for $22! The day we went, they were out of both chicken and sausage, which momentarily broke our hearts. They offered to double up on two other meats of our choice, to make up for it. We chose double brisket and double ribs. BUT THEN! When the food had arrived and we were already scarfing down, a waitress came up with a piece of sausage on a plate! They weren't out after all, and brought us a piece on the house. This small gesture made a big impression.

And the taste! I loved everything, and boyfriend - though more discerning - was pleased as punch. The brisket was a fatty cut, marbled throughout, tender, and delicious. The pulled pork was decadent, shredded into thick strips with chunks of crispy skin still attached in places -- AMAZING. The ribs were pork - tender, plump, and crazy tasty. I'm not usually a fan of ribs, but these had me literally licking my fingers clean. The sausage was great too - the skin was tight so that it burst when you bit down. 

As for sides, we ordered double cornbread (great texture and taste, but somehow missing the honey butter that everyone keeps talking about... sad day!), the steamed veggies (plain as can be, absolutely no seasoning), and the mac and cheese (mm! mmm! mmmmmm!). The portions were perfect. 

For that price, I was blown away by not only the quality, but the QUANTITY. It was truly an insane amount of food. We stuffed ourselves to the brim and still somehow managed to bring home leftovers for a bangin' lunch the next day. 

I also have to mention the sauces. As I've said in Yelp reviews before, I'm a saucy broad. I truly appreciate it when restaurants allow me the autonomy to drown my food in sauce as I see fit. Billy's BBQ offers each table a selection of their sauces: original, smokey, and hot. They were all spectacularly good, really. The original sauce is the thickest, tasting like a traditionally sweet BBQ sauce. It had those expected hints of molasses, brown sugar, and I even tasted a bit of apple. The smokey sauce had a bit more tang to it. Still thick, but with more depth of flavor, not as sweet, and with a definite current of smoke, as the name suggests. The hot BBQ sauce was my favorite! It was vinegar based with crushed pepper flakes, and the perfect amount of zing and heat. I was alternating dunking my bites into each of them, but I turned to the hot sauce the most frequently. 

Awesome experience, incredible BBQ -- thank you, Billy! We will be back!

Being a BBQ junkie we go everywhere a place opens we can find. I even found an old bbq friend running Billy's. Brisket (I had the fat) was tender and smoked perfect. Pulled pork was just a good. You don't need sauce but the sauces they have are good. I always order without sauce so I can taste the real meat. It is worth the drive wherever you are in Vegas.
Hands down the best BBQ in Vegas!! I cheated Billy's and went to try rolling smoke and never again.. I gotta get some Billy's to make up for that..

I'm from the south so I'm familiar with good BBQ (no, Famous Dave's is not good BBQ). This place serves probably the second best BBQ in town. The pulled pork was juicy and the sauces were great. The baked beans stole the show though. They put meat in the beans! It reminded me of home. 

Now for the negatives.. Firstly and most importantly, they don't offer sweet tea! This is a travesty! Their only tea options are unsweetened and raspberry tea (wtf?). get it, we're on the west coast, but you can't serve BBQ without sweet tea. Secondly, why is there a soft serve ice cream machine? It seemed gimmicky and out of place.
This place has amazing BBQ!! Friendly staff , restaurant very clean & modern . Their beef brisket is ridiculously good!! Highly recommend to anyone who wants great BBQ!!!

This place has the most incredible bbq I have ever had. Ever. The pulled pork was delicious and the fatty brisket was absolutely amazing. I've never had brisket melt in my mouth like theirs does. The smoked Mac and cheese was also great - it was creamy and delicious...definitely tastes like they homemade the white cheese sauce.

5 stars just can't do this place justice. The owner Billy came out to check on how everything was and I couldn't give him enough praise. This place really blew my expectations out of the water!

Great job Billy's BBQ - keep it up!!

Nicely decorated.  Clean and smells good.  Must say it's just about average.  It only made me crave better bbq...Lucile's.  Sad but true, even with the nicely portioned meat plate.  The bbq sauce raked of malt vinegar and was not even slightly hot.  The smokey bbq was too sweet.  The meat as I said, was only average.  Chopped brisket was super greasy on the plate also.  Tacos are over priced and undersized.  I might come back to see the friendly cutie standing behind the counter but not to eat.

Soooo good! This is the place to be for bbq! My husband and I got the sampler platter and it was more than enough to share. The shredded chicken and pork was my favorite! The manager was really sweet as well and very attentive to his guests, it seemed like he genuinely enjoyed being there. We'll definitely be back

This place went downhill fast. The first time we ate here, it was great. The second time, it was not good. The third time, they were out of ribs and brisket so we left (35 min before closing).

I was pleasantly surprised the first time, about how tender and flavorful everything was. The second time, the brisket was very dry (and bland) and the chicken was mediocre. The pickle fries were the only thing I enjoyed. I was reluctant to go back, but the hubby wanted to give them another try. But once we found out that they were out of ribs and brisket, what was the point in staying? How does a BBQ place run out of ribs and brisket? Needless to say, I won't be going back. Very disappointing.

My first experience at Billy's and I was disappointed. I ordered the brisket sandwich , waffle fries and a drink. 1) it was over priced for the atmosphere/ food / service. Lunch was $18.95 for order / pick up style. The brisket was greasy and had too much fat; the waffle fries were over fried. Worst part my sister found a hair in her brisket taco. #fail 
As a Texas girl I always want to check out BBQ spots but I doubt I will ever return to Billy's

If you do nothing else in life, you need to eat at this restaurant. The service was good, the food was incredible, and the options were awesome. If I didn't live 40+ minutes away, I'd come here once a week or more. If you like good, real BBQ that doesn't come out of the warmer pre-packaged (ahem, Dickeys)... Then you need to check this place out. As a deep South Georgia boy, I give this place two sauce-covered thumbs up!

Best BBQ I've had besides my South Carolina BBQ, but even then, it may be better. The sides are huge portions, and all fresh and unique in their flavor. The brisket was soooo tender, the pulled pork flavored just right and the pulled chicken was incredible. Get the fried pickles with the Alabama white sauce they come with, and the BBQ baked beans here scream Fresh and home made recipe! Everything we got was unbelievable. We WILL be back!!
Great BBQ and even better service!  Best brisket in Vegas - hands down...  And great pickle fries.  Even came with complimentary cobbler!!!  Will definitely make this a frequent choice for going out.

This place was great! The smell hits you right when you walk through the door. It was nice to be able to order, get your food quickly, and then head out. Billy and his staff were great. The chicken and pork were delicious and nice and tender. The sauces were AMAZING. 
The only issue we had was price. For the type of bbq joint it is (with plastic cutlery and plates) you would expect more options in the sub $10 range.
Overall it was great, my wallet and I will tough it out and go again!

This is my second trip, up to 4 stars now.   Had the pit master sandwich, big portion, meats were flavorful.  Smoked Mac n cheese was delicious.  Very creamy and saucy!!!   The only knock is no BBQ sauce included with my to go order.  Sandwich was huge, needed sauce.  But good solid BBQ.  Will go for a combo plate next time I go.  Way to get better!!!

I'm a picky...this bar b que is the best I've ever had! Flavor is unreal. I'll never go to a Lucille's or Famous Daves again. Smokey meat flavor, seasoning is perfect, MAC & CHEESE is the bomb. A perfect amount of heat on the beans. Shrimp was killer!!! The sauces on hand have just the right balance of sweet and savory. I was blown away by how good it was.They're just starting up it seems, so trying to work things out but man they got something special here. Warning, they do sell out of their meat...but for good reason!! Inside is nice. Service is great.  What an amazing independent spot. Overall must go! I'll definitely be a regular.

Billy's was great and below average.  There were two huge red flags for me, first there was no smoke in the air or aroma of BBQ outside of the restaurant and there were not a lot of people there  

The great was their brisket, both fatty and lean were excellent, especially the fatty, no matter where you get brisket, the lean tends to be a bit dry especially if you, like me, are not going to eat it right away.  Nice, flavorful crust that was heavenly.  Their smokey BBQ sauce is awesome.

Now on the to ribs, really disappointed.  I was prepared for the ribs to be not very good as soon as I looked at the menu.  I usually avoid BBQ places that serve things like shrimp,  tacos and fries, IMHO they are doing too much and need to focus on BBQ.  I don't see any Mexican or seafood restaurants serving BBQ ribs.   I was correct in regards to their ribs.  No flavor whatsoever, tasted like they seasoned the ribs with paprika only, I wonder if they had seen an outdoor charcoal or wood pit.  I bet they were cooked on an indoor grill on in the oven then finished on a grill.  If so, shame, shame, shame on you Billy!  Their website claims the ribs are smoked daily for 12-15 hours, interesting. I wonder where all of that smoke goes.  Could barely finish them, thank goodness I ordered the brisket too.  The beans were not good either.

I'll definitely return for the brisket.

Oh, one other problem.  They have no bread!!!  All they have is cornbread and you have to buy it separately if you order just meat, most places give you bread free when you order a pound of meat.  Any self respecting BBQ joint must have plain white bread!!!   That's the golden rule!!  No pork or chicken links either, just beef.  WTH??

Staff is ALWAYS courteous. Restaurant and restrooms are clean.
The first time we came in the food was PHENOMENAL. Seriously, so good.
Tonight, it was subpar. We ordered the sampler platter (this is more than enough food for 2 adults and a child), with an extra side.
The sampler comes with brisket, sausage, 2 ribs, chicken and pork. You also receive 2 sides and a piece of cornbread.
The brisket this time was ALL fat. There was barely any meat on any of it. The pork and chicken were dry both times. Ribs are good. I didn't particularly care for the sausage, but my husband really likes it.
My three year old devours the brisket baked beans (they've since changed to smoked meat baked beans- not as good, but still tasty). The waffle fries are gross. Seriously, just don't bother. There is a weird crust on them. Is it breading/batter? Is it a weird cheese type situation? Idk, but they were inedible, and were tossed . Sweet potato fries were a better choice. My husband RAVED about the smoked bacon Mac and cheese. 
There is no dessert on the menu (unless you count a weird cornbread fritter thing.)

All in all, I think this place is a decent addition to the SW, but we won't be back as frequently as we originally thought.  Keep the meats from drying out, don't serve a meat sampler platter with 1 of your meats being only fat, and if a customer says something about it- take charge of the situation.
New containers are cumbersome also. Paper type products don't hold up well with sauces, fat juices, and bbq sauce. 

I will try this place again in a month or two and see if the kinks have been worked out.
BesT BBQ in the state bar none. Come on hungry as the pile it on. The food is freaking awesome and the service is great.

Great local BBQ spot!   I started off with the gutbuster fries.  They no longer make them with waffle fries but they are still phenomenal.  Don't pass them up.  I also had the 2 meat platter with brisket and pulled pork.  The brisket was good but the pork was better.  It had a great taste and nice char to it.  Make sure you order the BBQ baked beans too.  Overall they had  great food and I will definitely be back.
The beans are soo good! A meal in itself cause its packed  with brisket. The corn bread is amazing.  Only negative  thing  is they need to bring back the fried pickles!

The food here is great! Try the white BBQ sauce its very very good. I found out about these guys at the San Gennaro Feast back in September 2014 when they were passing out samples of their food prior to the opening of their restaurant.

Its worth trying, its a tad pricey though
Very very good! Everything was so authentic and homemade you can tell they take time and pride in their food and presentation! Will be back

I would give it 4.5* but I will round up.  Had a sampler platter that had a bit of everything.  It included brisket, pulled pork, chicken, 4 ribs, a hot link, and 4 sides for 21.99.  Very good amount of food and 2 people could easily split it.  Excellent price and overall the food was very good.

In order of excellence...

Pulled Pork: 5/5.  The meat was well cooked, juicy and tender, and very flavorful even without sauce.  Would make a great sandwich.

Pulled chicken: 5/5.  Same as above.

Ribs: 3.5/5.  They were good...but not great.  The meat was a little soft, and I like my ribs a little more taut so to speak.  The flavor was alright, but a little weak.  They were definitely not bad, and I would not be unhappy to eat a rack of them, but they did not blow me away.  Still solid though.

Hot link:. 1/5.  I hated it.  Simple as that.  I did not like the flavor or the texture.  The only low point for me.

The sides...

Greens: 4/5.  Spicy and tasty.  Could have used a little meat in them, and they were a little soggy, but they were still good.

Okra: 4/5.  Well fried, good texture.  The flavor was a little weak in the seasoning department, but they were good and very well cooked.

Beans: 3.75/5.  They were good.  They had large chunks of meat in them, but I did not think the flavor was robust enough.  Still good though.

Cornbread: 3/5.  Too sweet.  It was good but tasted like a dessert.  I want my cornbread a little less sweet, and I would love corn in it.

They offer free soft serve to everyone in the place, and the service was pleasant enough, and it was pretty quick (except for the link which came out way after everything else).  Overall, the food was very good and well done, and actually tasted like actual BBQ.  The price was also excellent at $22 for the huge amount of food I got.  I would put the food on quality overall at a solid 4/5, but given the price and the value, I would bump it up to 4.5, and since I am overall pleased and can't give 4.5 for some inexplicable reason, I round up.
The first place to cure my craving for real southern BBQ in Vegas! The food is amazing, the service is so friendly and it is super clean. Can't ask for much more than that.

This is the best BBQ in town!!! It took us forever to decide on dinner tonight & we are so glad we tried it! 

The guys had ribs - so much food!!  I had a pulled pork sandwich. The meat was awesome with truly no fat, the coleslaw creamy & delicious, the bun yummy & toasted!! My favorite side was mac & cheese.  As per earlier reviews, they run out of things as the evening wears on & they were out of sweet potato fries, so I am guessing those are really good, too!!

They have dozens of specialty root beers - so that was fun!! And the banana pudding had freshly sliced bananas & still-crispy nilla wafers!!! Fine work, gentlemen!!

We will be back!!!

Really good bbq! I had the pulled pork sandwich which was tender and flavorful except for the coleslaw. I tend to like sweeter coleslaw and theirs really didn't do anything for the sandwich. I recommend the French fries (I know, sorry) but there were the perfect mix of crispy outside and soft inside. My husband had the two meat combo of ribs and pulled chicken. The ribs were good... Not the best ever but still good. The pulled chicken however was probably the highlight. We ended with the banana pudding. One is enough for two to share and a very sweet ending note to a very good meal. Other notes: the cornbread is on the sweeter side and comes with an even sweeter butter. 
Overall, I easily recommend this place to any BBQ enthusiasts.

Stopped by out of curiosity and think I finally found a decent BBQ joint in Vegas. Not really sure what all the menu is about so I just asked the girls up front what the best dishes were. They were super friendly and suggested I try the ribs and the brisket. Both were on point. I also took their recommendations on the sides; the bacon Mac and cheese was great and the baked beans were the bomb! I also got the brisket tacos and though they were rather small, they were tasty nonetheless! They also put some cornbread with the order; it was tasty and sweet, almost like a piece of cake wit the cornbread texture.  What also caught my eye was the numerous varieties of bottles root beer they have on hand. I love microbrew'ed root beer and they definitely had a huge selection! I'll try this place again for sure! Way better than the daves place nearby and I would honestly put this food a step up from rolling smoke.

This is about my 8th time in and the previous 7 times were beyond phenomenal. Everything came out perfect. The skinny French fries were one of the best I've had in town. The mac n cheese was the best I've had at any BBQ joint. It was nice and creamy. The brisket choices were lean or fatty. I got both. It was moist and flavorful. The baby back ribs were nice and tender and fell off the bone. It was seriously the best BBQ I've had in town......until now!!!!!

Apparently Billy's BBQ is now under new ownership and new chef. The food has taken a huge dive. The brisket is now dry. The ribs still fall off the bone but aren't tender, they are dry. The Mac n cheese is no longer rich and creamy. It's now baked and oily and comes in a clump. All you taste is macaroni and oil. That's because that's what the owner likes. The French fries are no longer skinny French fries. They are now crinkle fries because that's what the owner likes. This has been the worst BBQ I've ever had. I would rather eat at Famous Dave's and I don't like their food. 

The owner can out and asked if how was everything and I told him that it was horrible. He asked, "is there anything I can do?" I told him bring back the old menu. His response to me was, "not going to happen" then he walked away. 

The fact that he cares more about what "he" likes versus what the consumers that keep coming back like is a horrible way to run a restaurant.

Yes, I did receive a refund. I never asked for one. I'm not one of those people that do that. As for your former employee, I've never met the guy and he is a friend of a friend. I came by to enjoy great BBQ not knowing that it was under new ownership and chef. I was unaware that recipes were changed. 

I am willing to try this again as I understand that not every plate comes out perfect.
Really good brisket...good pork..  all around one of the better BBQ places in the valley

First time eating at Billy's and I'm quite impressed. The Super Mac bowl with the brisket was delicious. Though I felt it could use something crunchy. So I put a side of coleslaw on top and that was better. It was good, but not the vineagery coleslaw is was hoping for. Would definitely come back again.
The BBQ shrimp tacos were amazing with their house bbq sauce. The pulled pork sandwich with pickle fries were on point.

Billy's has been on my radar for a while as I'm always looking for a good BBQ place in Vegas.  It's kind of a no frills approach to BBQ but in a good way.  The main focus is the BBQ and food not all the other stuff.  By that I mean it's a pretty casual setting where you order at the front and they bring out the food.  

The food ... I was able to sample pretty much everything as we ordered a lot of food to share between 10 people.  The standouts were the ribs and brisket.  The ribs had a spicy touch and were served dry (not loaded with BBQ sauce).  Which is a good approach so you can add how much sauce you want.  The brisket was tender and had a nice pepper finish, also served dry.  The sides were all good but the beans and mac and cheese were the standouts.  Both full of flavor and made a nice addition to the meal.

A good addition to the Vegas BBQ scene!

I liked it!  Very flavorful.  I tried the pulled pork sandwich, slaw and mac and cheese. Corn Bread is pretty good too.  I think it's better than Famous Dave's and Lucille's and the old Buzz BBQ.  They probably will outgrow this facility.  Might be hard for some to find tucked away in the shopping plaza at Flamingo and Grand Canyon.  Just look for the stores in front of Target near the round about and you will find it.

Just ate here for the first time and I am thrilled I found this place. For the past two years I have been trying to find good bbq in Las Vegas and everything I tried was, honestly, not very good. Then I found this spot. I had the two meat plate with brisket and ribs. I also added mac'n cheese and pickle fries. There wasn't a single item that I ate that I wouldn't give 5 stars to. The meats were tender, smoky and so juicy. I think the best part though was the bark on the brisket. The dry rub mixture here is phenomenal. As for the sides, the fries were crispy and didn't fall apart at all like other fried pickles I've had. The mac'n cheese was gooey and made with spiral noodles for the maximum cheese to noodle ratio. I will definitely be back with all my friends.

This is the first week that they have implemented the new changes. Let me start off by saying WE LOVE BILLIES BBQ. We are regulars so we have seen how the restaurant has evolved for the good. We were greeted by the new owner and he took the time to walk us through the menu. I would suggest the Sampler platter. The reason is so you can have the opportunity to sample the brisket, ribs, pork, sausage and chicken and two sides. We picked the fried pickles (my favorite) and potato salad. Then we added collard greens which were surprisingly good.  The meal comes with a roll which was light and fluffy. It was perfect for soaking up the juices in my plate. We received a complimentary peach cobbler which was DELISH. I am not a peach cobbler fan, but I would eat that for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

A Happy Friday/birthday dinner this was NOT! Went with friends to pick up a friend's birthday dinner since Billy's has always been a favorite but what a sad surprise! No more cornbread, no more dirty coke and SMALL portions...my "large" Mac n cheese was smaller than a small side at KFC. Spent over $30 on disappointment...

i drove all the way here and it was closed. I was so excited to get it as I have credit on a order... i drove 20 minutes just to come here. Hope you aren't closing down . when will u be back up and running

I'm a dumbass for coming back. While food really is delicious, the service is unbearable. Got an order to go and didn't check it before we left. (I should know better) we got home and only got 1/2 of what we ordered. Called and came back to sit and wait for them to make good on the serious short changed order. If I called Forst and you knew it was messed up, have it ready for me!!!!! Otherwise I have plenty of time to sit and wait for you all pissed of and write a Yelp review. Shame on me for coming back!! Not again!                                            Oh- I waited on hold to place the order for 15 minutes because the set the phone down and forgot about me...that should have been my red flag...

I hate having to leave this review, but hopefully it helps Billy's get its act together so it doesn't fail like so many other small BBQ joints in Las Vegas. 

We called the day prior to see what time they closed, as 8pm is advertised. The staff member told us that they didn't know because sometimes it was earlier. This was a bad sign, as typically that only happens if there's no business and the owner is trying to save money on payroll. Though you end up frustrating customers if they show up at 7, and your door says you're open until 8, only to find out you closed early.

Three guests (two dragged all the way out from Henderson on my recommendation, to try a new local spot that's supposed to be good). -- The free soft serve ice cream sealed the deal for at least one of them. 

- Ice cream machine broken. (Sorry, Ken.)

We were still looking forward to the food, which is supposed to be good. 

- Sold out of sausage. 

Please keep in mind that Adrienne, our cashier, was amazing -- even under pressure. She gets 5-stars, and should probably work somewhere that doesn't set her up for failure.

- Food took forever, presumably because Adrienne was also training two new employees in the kitchen. My friends' orders were first to come out: Cold mac & cheese, room temperature meat, dry as a brick cornbread.

Adrienne was great, and remade one of the plates. 

- My order came incorrect (3-meat platter, with the wrong meat), and also room temperature. However, I don't like piping hot food - so that was fine. Sides came much later. 

We let the staff know that my brisket never arrived, but 30 minutes later (about 75 minutes into our dining experience) we hadn't heard anything - so we packed up a few boxes, washed our hands, and prepared to leave. The missing brisket arrived as we were about to walk out the door. 

A "sold out" sign was placed on the door, and the doors were locked, prior to 7pm. Our last 30 minutes or so featured about a half dozen customers looking at us enjoying our food through the locked glass doors -- unable to give Billy's their money (even though 8pm is the advertised closing time).

I love BBQ. I love local BBQ joints. I hate seeing them fail. Even more, I hate seeing four kids (two brand new) thrown to the wolves during a busy dinner rush. Where was "Billy?"

Got there at 6pm, got most food at 6:30pm, got corrected food at 7:15. Not a good experience at all. (Except Adrienne, who was just trying to hold it all together in the absence of a manager/owner.)

These issues are easily fixed, and I hope they are -- because the food was pretty good. (Aside from the cornbread)
From Kansas City, so we have a high standard for BBQ and this definitely met our expectations. We can't wait to come back for more!
I went there recently for the first time. I had the chopped brisket, chicken, pork plate. It's a huge plate, for the side, mac and cheese it was very good, I will definitely be back.
FOOD IS AMAZING! By far the best BBQ  I've had in town. The chef there Franco does an outstanding job at preparing his meals. I would definitely go back without a doubt.

Have visted twice and purchased a Sampler plate to share.  Biggest disappointment was that the meat temperature was not at all warm and the cole slaw was not cold. We advised the counter employee of our concern.   Second visit was Monday 4/27/15 to try the sandwich special (Mondays only as on website) which includes a sandwich, drink, and one side for $8.  We were told that they no longer serve the special.  It is still on the website, however.  We again ordered the Sampler plate, but we did not get a sausage.  Again, the meat was not hot, no even warm and the cole slaw was not cold.  Have not decided if we will try this place again. Two ad out is probably our limit. I worry about the low temp of the meat and where it was setting -- not on a warmer or in a refrigerator.  I still prefer Memphis Championship BBQ on Warm Springs.  Everytime we try a new BBQ in Las Vegas, we go back to Memphis Championship BBQ for the St. Louis ribs.

I had a pretty positive experience here. I came here for my birthday because I was craving BBQ. I didn't want the typical BBQ from Famous Dave's so I found this place on yelp. When I first entered, it felt a little awkward because I didn't know whether I'm supposed to sit down or order at the counter. I thought it was going to be a sit down kind of restaurant. Anyways I walked up to the counter and I ordered the 2 meat plate. They have the option of choosing a fatty brisket or a leaner one. Of course I picked the fattier brisket because that's where all the flavor happens. Duh. I also got ribs with a side of fries and Mac and cheese. When they brought out my plate of food I was blown away by the size of their brisket. They were big slabs of brisket and the fat to meat ratio was perfecto. So juicy....Ughh just drooling thinking about it. The ribs were also delicious and tender. Yum O. The Mac and cheese was also really good. People usually don't pay attention to how they make the Mac and cheese, but they've done it well. I like this place and I would definitely come again.

Our first time at Billy's BBQ and it was so incredible, I had to write a review!

My husband and I entered and were warmly greeted by Nik on register. She lead us through the menu and made suggestions.

My husband ordered the 2 meat plate with chicken and pork plus a large side of fries. I ordered a 2 meat plate with brisket and chicken plus 2 small sides of baked beans and corn bread.

It was a short wait and then Nik came out, her arms full of food and set it all down in front of us. Ut oh, did we order too much for just two people?

Very nice sized portions. My brisket slices were thick and had a delicious salt crust along the edge. I didn't need a knife, the brisket fell apart with just the pressure from the fork!

Pulled chicken was fantastic! Nice and juicy, big pieces, not little shreds.

The pork was well cooked and tender.

There are several sauces to choose from. "White Thunder" is a vinegar and mayo based sauce and was perfect for dipping fries into. There are also original, hot and smoky sauces to chose from. I mixed the hot and the original to create my own blend.

The staff was very friendly, especially Nik who is very sweet and charming. The food is exceptional. A perfect lunch experience. 

My husband was pleased to see Dr. Pepper as a selection in the fountain sodas.

And.... everyone gets free ice cream!!! Hooray!

"Billy! Billy dont you lose my number!"

Where's Phil Collins when you need him?

Anyways, I was really hungry so i ordered the 3 Meat Plate ($17.99) which consisted of Baby Back Ribs, Pulled Pork, and Brisket. Their other meat choices were Pulled Chicken and Spicy Brisket Sausage.
