Comes with your choice of either 1 large side or 2 small sides I wanted to try more than 1 side so I went with a small Mac n Cheese and Corn Bread. I also opted for a soda ($2.49). Total I spent was a tad over 21 bucks.

At first I thought this was a bit much but after receiving my meal you could say the price was somewhat justified once I saw that portions were generous. After all, they are located in an expensive part of a plaza. The previous restaurant before them was what I thought pretty successful so I was kind of shocked to find out they closed. 

As for the food, the Brisket was really good. It was juicy and had the a touch of smokiness to it. I like the pepper seasoning that they have on it. The Pulled Pork was average compared to some other places. The Ribs? It was kind of a disappointment. It was not all that tender which leads to it not easily falling off the bone. It was kind of bland actually.

Service was just ok. Of course the day I went, they had a new girl working so some mistakes were made but they were genuine in their apologies. You order at the counter and then they bring it out to you. Memo to management: You guys need a better system of figuring who's order is what instead of walking around trying to remember who ordered what. I was given somebody else's order which was similar. Good thing I didnt start digging into it yet.

Lastly, i cant forget to mention their barbeques sauces. They have 3 flavors. Original, hot, and smoky. The hot is a kicked up version of the original. The smokey has a hint of smoke and vinegar. These sauces are available next to the soda machine. Feel free to bring them back to your table. They also have little to go cup containers for you to take some home. Im not sure if you can purchase the bottles because I forgot to ask them. Their sauces are pretty good. in the end, I put all three together on the brisket and pulled pork. They taste pretty good mixed together.

Overall, I thought the brisket here is what really stood out. I will reserve judgement for the chicken and fried pickle chips which I heard were really good. For now I will always compare every barbeque joint to my favorite 5 star location in town. Message me for that particular place and no, its not a chain.

Yelp 2015 review #19
518 overall

Delicious.dont think twice.it is all good.
The one negative.Prob one of the only bbq places with no beer.ahh well!
Great food.
It was delicious!!! Best BBQ in town. This is a new favorite. We will def be coming back .  Probably more frequently than we should!

I was so sad when Manhattan Fish Grill closed, but Billy's BBQ is a wonderful (if not unhealthier) replacement! The workers here, especially the ladies at the front, are very helpful and want to make sure you enjoy your experience. I prefer the 3-meat plate of pork ribs, pulled pork and pork brisket (fatty pieces). Aside from the delicious and succulent meats, their sides are on point. The fried pickles have a nice texture (but are not on the regular menu, see if they have them available) and the baked beans come with small pieces of meat mixed within it. My favorite side though is the corn bread.. the butter that comes with it pairs so well with it! The only side I didn't really care for is the mac n cheese, just not my cup of tea. Don't forget to ask for an ice cream cone and grab yourself some vanilla soft serve. The only thing that stops me from OD'ing on BBQ is the women's bathroom sign that says "Heifers" :P

Decided to try Billy's BBQ for dinner and it was delicious! I ordered the 3 meat combo which consisted of ribs, brisket and pulled pork with bacin mac n cheese and fried okra. The brisket was tender and flavorful. My mom ordered the 2 meat combo with brisket and pulled pork. We really enjoyed our meal had lots of leftovers. We will definitely be back again soon! Just need to leave room for the banana pudding next time, it looked so good!

My husband and I had been out Christmas shopping when we found this gem. We are bbq lovers/Vegas natives and have yet to find a place this good in town. I had the Heavenly Hog sandwich and my husband had the 2 meat platter with cole slaw and the smoked Mac and cheese. The food was amazingly delicious.  Another plus about our experience was being welcomed by one of the owners. He made the effort to greet and chat with every customer in the restaurant. We will definitely be back again.

YUCK, NASTY tasting food! Worst place ever I got the pulled chicken sandwich, chicken was salty and had a weird taste to it took 2 bites and trashed it my side was macaroni and cheese which was also AWFUL it was pasta with clumps of cheese lots of oil or butter whatever it was on the bottom of the bowl not creamy just NASTY took 2 bites and trashed it. My husband got the 2 meat platter he got pulled chicken same reaction NASTY he got ribs too also NASTY awful taste to them too only thing good were his fries we wasted  $31.00 there very upsetting and left hungry their bbq sauce also AWFUL! I wouldn't even mark 1 star but you have to mark something they should get negative stars! Waste of money and have a hungry tummy

I would walk over hot coals for great BBQ!!
I know that sounds a bit dramatic, but it is kinda true!

I am doing 4 stars because I liked a so many things here at Billy's...not everything but most everything! The counter service was friendly and a pleasure to order from. 

The most important part of BBQ...THE MEAT!!! Moo, Oink, YES!
REALLY like the flavor of the 3 meats plate! I had Fatty Brisket (DON'T JUDGE! OK, you can judge! I judge myself, but I love the flavor!), smoked sausage and ribs. All three were great. The brisket was delicious and tender, totally fork friendly. The ribs were tasty, and smokey. The sausage was good, had great flavor, a little over smoked but still good. 

The sides I had...Mac and Cheese was my biggest disappointment of the meal. Usually one of my favorite parts, but here is was kind of MEH. A little soggy, and the flavor was nothing special. But for redemption, we ordered "pickle fries" - YUM!!! Sliced pickle spears lightly battered and fried. Enough for the table to enjoy for sure!

And the cutest part...for dessert they have a free soft serve ice cream machine. 

We had fun! And I would happily head back!
Oink!

Billy's is that place you go to when you're stress eating and need a pile of carbs and meat.  I love the short and sweet menu.  The food is great, although it changes time and again either in texture for sauces or in flavor of some of the meat.  Still, great place to stop in for some BBQ.

very yummy. 
the ribs are very tender and tasty
the mac-n-cheese was yummy
the beans was really really good, except i'd have to actually say it was just TOO much sweetness when taking a bite of the ribs afterwards. maybe that was my fault for adding the extra bbq sauce on the ribs.

We recently used Billys BBQ to cater part of our wedding reception. We absolutly LOVE thier sides. The cornbread and beans with brisket are to die for. I couldn't wait when I got home from my honeymoon to eat more of the beans that we have saved and they were still delicious. Highly recommend them for the sides at least. My husband loves to smoke his own meats so we only got our sides but they were awesome.
This place was recommended to us by a friend and it is truly AH MAZE ING. The pickle fries made me all warm and fuzzy inside. If only there were fried green tomatoes and peach cobbler on the menu...

Billy's is one of those places I really wanted to like. We already have a pretty disappointing BBQ scene in Vegas, but Billy's hasn't been open long and seemed to be getting mostly positive reviews. It's been one of my bookmarks pretty much since their opening week . Lately though, I've noticed more negative reviews popping up, so when I walked in and the first thing I heard was a customer asking "is this supposed to be cold too?" I had a feeling why...only confirmed after our experience started. 

The restaurant is fast casual style where you order at the counter and they bring the food to you. There's not a whole lot to it, but I liked how it has a locals feel to it. After browsing the menu, I walked up to start placing our order and it turned into a back and forth ordeal. The wifey wanted a pulled pork sandwich with mac and cheese, no mac and cheese. Someone at our table wanted chicken breast, out of chicken breast. When they wanted to switch to the wrap, it's made with that same chicken so they could only do it with pulled chicken. My order was the 2 Meat Plate which they thankfully had, but out of greens for one of the sides. I then went to order my son the Super Mac & Cheese forgetting that they just said they were out, but she put it in no problem. I didn't end up putting the two together until after I sat down, but it ended up coming out without a problem. Unless it's just frozen and put into the right size bowl, it was pretty confusing. 

Our food didn't take long to come out, but came out in weird strides. I had my sides of fried okra and sweet potato fries a good 5 minutes before my meat came out. Both sides were okay, but the wife's fried pickles were the best side of the night. I do like that they give you a good size portion on the sides though. If anything, it was maybe even a little too much, as I couldn't even finish mine. 

After we got all of our food, I figured out what the customer I overheard was talking about being cold. My sons Super Mac & Cheese was cold to the touch. Even the meat on top of it was cold, so I don't know if they made it first and let it sit, or what happened...but it wasn't good at all. Even he barely touched it. 

The meat was definitely the star of the show, but it wasn't necessarily shining. Their brisket had a great smokey flavor, and it was tender, but it was much dryer than I thought it would be. I really enjoyed their sausage though, and is my biggest reasoning behind the 3 star review. It's a little tough on the exterior, possibly just a tad overdone that day, but had absolutely amazing flavor. There was great smoke flavor, a really bold peppery taste, and it was probably one of the best sausages I've ever had. It may not look it, but it's not even the least bit dry either. Thankfully so, because I wasn't a huge fan of their sauces. The hot had pretty much no heat, and even though I thought their original was the better of the 3, I couldn't help but feel like they were all just straight from a branded bottle. Had the brisket not been on the dry side, I would have stayed away from the sauce altogether. 
 
Aside from the food, their service isn't the greatest. They have a lot of younger kids working in here, but they didn't seem too familiar with the menu and they seemed more interested in loudly goofing off with each other. We also saw some kid walk in who supposedly use to work there, and walked right into the kitchen. I even heard one of the girls say "he used to work here, I'm not just letting some random guy in the kitchen"...but then he was kinda wandering around, messing with their POS system and making jokes that they already took him out of it. I don't know if they have a management issue, or don't have one at all, but they kinda just do whatever they want. At least it's a clean restaurant though. 

For 3 adults, and 1 kid, we spent about $50. I like that they give you big portions on the meat and sides, but I wouldn't say the food justifies it, or the drive we have to make to get here. Because the sausage was so good, I'd recommend at least trying that. I myself would come back for it, and maybe even try the ribs that seem to get great reviews...but it probably won't be anytime soon.

As a southerner in a previous life I am required by law to love BBQ.  My buddy was told to try this place by fellow Yelpers.  Nice location and ok inside.  The drink machine was ill placed but not a big issue since it wasn't crowded.  The service was not up to par.  The brought things one at a time and also my came out 10 minutes after my fellow guest first item.  My daughter and buddy had ordered the same 3 tacos and in 3 plates with the same tacos on each plate.  Instead of bringing them all at once with the 3 varieties on 1 plate for each of them.  The delivery was a true miss and a big letdown.  They said the smoked chicken taco was the best and the other two just so-so.  I had the Pork BBQ sandwich and sweet potato fries.  The pork BBQ had a slight smoked taste which was deep in the background.  The meat was dry which was another letdown.  The bun had a funny taste from the old oil they had used to toast it on the grill.  
   The sweet potato fries were very good.  Their sauces are spicy and remind me of TX BBQ sauces.  I had asked the young lady who took my order the style of BBQ and got a blank stare.  I have had better BBQ in Vegas at Rolling Smoke which I recommend.  If in the area this place would be OK for lunch but I wouldn't drive out of my way to come here.
Easy fast and tasty. The deviled eggs were perfect, the brisket sandwich was huge and totally tasty and the baked beans were delightfully unique!  Will be back.
The Brisket is so good, especially over fries.. They are very nice here as well which makes dinning in so much better...
Excellent BBQ and service! They are so friendly too my 3 loud kiddos who love and devour the food. The brisket is the best that I've ever had!

I'm from Oklahoma and alway try new bbq. There are very few if any bbq joints in Vegas. 

Billy's does qualify. The beans are ok. The coleslaw is very dry and not recommended. 

The lean brisket has too much fat attached but tastes ok. The sausage is interesting , ok. 

The best I had was the ribs. Pretty yummy!

I will return to try the pulled pork, corn bread and other sides.

Yay!!! BBQ!!!! Who doesn't love BBQ!!! Nice portion of meats and yummy cornbread n Mac n cheese - I've been looking for a good BBQ spot since I've moved - and this is the one - great smoked flavor - tender and juicy -  mI  this place - I will for sure be a regular!!!! I'm already planning my next meal this week  - Thank you Billy's!!!!!
Love the brisket!  Makes me miss Texas!  Friendly crew too!

My brisket was fabulous ! My husband got the ribs and loved them, I didn't care for them but I'm from St. Louis so I'm a bit picky. The coleslaw was my favorite side. And the fresh bread is a nice touch! The owner came out and introduced himself and gave us some complimentary peach cobbler which was VERY good. So awesome to have a great BBQ joint on this side of town.

As someone who grew up eating some of the best BBQ that the State of Texas has to offer, it kills me to say that this place has the absolute best brisket I've ever had.  I even order mine lean, and it was still juicy and flavorful.   It was seasoned perfect and it was melt in your mouth delicious.  And much like the brisket in Texas, it really doesn't need any sauce.  They have three choices of sauce, but I didn't have any of them.  The brisket was just that good.  I wanted to try the potato salad, but they were out.  However, after finding out it had onions, I'm glad I didn't get any.  The Mac & Cheese was great though.  The service was good,  I waited five minutes at the most and they were friendly.  The place was also very clean.  Now for the reason it didn't get five stars, besides being out of the potato salad (and it having onions).  The Brisket Baked Beans were quite possibly the worst beans I've ever eaten.  It tasted like someone opened a can of Ranch Style Beans and poured sweet BBQ sauce in them and added some chopped brisket.  And they needed to cook about 30 minutes longer.  It's a little hidden as well.  Just look for the Target and it's in the little strip center in front.  This is definitely the BEST BBQ place in Vegas, hands down.  It was so good, on Friday I got a half-pound of brisket.  I went back Saturday and got a full pound.  And no I've only a small portion of it so far.  It was just that good.

BBQ on my side of town FINALLY!!! So good!!! Only thing I didn't like was the food didn't come at the same time so my food was ready before the kids and you know how kids can be!!! Also the Gutbuster fries are awesome but I recommend switching back to waffle fries or a fatter fry!!! But I'll be back
Finally made it to another Yelp spot I wanted to try the barbecue was amazing the fried okra was to die for service was outstanding definitely a spot I'll try again

Let me start off by saying... I am not a fan of bbq.... However Billy's made me a believer. The hog heaven is truly a masterpiece. I ask for the Hottest bbq sauce they keep behind the counter! It has excellent flavor, I slather my meat in it and just go to town! My boyfriend gets the Ribs he loves them! Hardy and fall off the bone delicious. Would recommend this place to friends and family!

The best ribs I've ever had in my life!  Billys is excellent and I take my family there often.  The restaurant is very clean and a fun atmosphere for families.  The people are friendly and offer great service.  I would recommend Billys to everyone.  This place is awesome!

Wife took me here for lunch the other day. WOW. Only had the tacos (2 pulled pork, and 1 brisket) and wow the flavors and the hint of spice to give it a bit of kick were awesome. Giving 4 start based off that one meal but will be back to update after I have eaten there a couple more times. Excellent first visit.

Tried this place out for my fiance's birthday and it was a great find! He was getting sick and was beginning to lose his taste and I was worried he would have a terrible birthday. But this place... Oh man, it was delicious! The way they cooked their meat was just right and their bbq was tangy and perfect! The only thing that made me take a star off was the small side portions. We had mac and cheese and corn bread and I wish it was bigger because it was so so good!

The staff was very friendly. We had the sampler. The brisket had good flavor and was tender. The chicken was overcooked as were the ribs. The pork had good smoked but was dry. The sausage had no smoke at all. The collars were lacking flavor but if you like pork in your greens you'll like these. The cobbler at the end was a nice touch. I'd go back got the brisket but nothing else on the sampler.

First time trying this place out after seeing great reviews, and I must say...either I caught the tail end of the meat or people just don't understand what southern bbq is all about. Tried the pit master which is a mix of pulled pork and brisket, and the pork was so dry I had to keep applying sauce every 2-3 bites. 
The portion size was great, but the dryness of the meat made it too meh for me. I can say the talk of the Mac-n-cheese is true, it's absolutely fantastic. 
Also told the girl it was my first time ever there and never got a question during my whole time there how I was doing or what I thought. 
Most likely won't be back.

Here is a picture of the super dry meat.

This place is a great BBQ joint. It has a fast food kind of vibe. You go to the counter and order and then someone brings it to you. The BBQ was okay and I ordered the ribs and chopped brisket. My sides were the Mac and cheese and fried okra. The fried okra was perfectly fried. I love okra! The Mac and cheese was good and super creamy. The sweet potato fries were just okay. Felt like it was missing something. Overall, everything was just okay, not great. Just feel like something was missing. Maybe it lacked spices? The BBQ sauces were good though. I would give it 3.5 stars. Four meals and 3 drinks cost us around 80 dollars. I feel like the combo meals that start at 15 bucks or so, should at least come with cornbread too.
Food was good.  Had a sampler platter and it had a little of everything. Will definitely go back. The BBQ sauces were good too.

Despite only being open a few months I think Billy's BBQ has already outlasted the previous tenants, Manhattan Fish Grill. The space is set up as fast-casual restaurant -- order at the counter, grab a seat, and they'll bring the food to you. My two trips here have been for take out. Not an ideal way to sample a restaurants food, but definitely convenient when you're in a hurry shuttling your kid to and from activities. 

The pulled pork was my favorite of the three proteins I've tried. I love the flavor and crispy edges despite the slightly oily aftertaste. When ordering brisket, they give you the choice of a lean or fatty cut, or a mix of the two. The mix was a nice ratio of the two, leaning more towards lean cuts. The dry rub on the brisket provided hints of smokiness and heat making additional sauces unnecessary. The ribs were tender enough but lacked the charred exterior, or bark, that I prefer. They weren't the best ribs I've had but better than what you'll find at any of the chain restaurants around town.

Sides and dessert are their weak link. The mac and cheese, using shell pasta, was thick and gummy, while the cornbread was dry and crumbly. You'll be reaching for a drink with every bite. The s'mores brownie seemed pedestrian -- quality akin to a basic store bought brownie, topped with marshmallows and caramel sauce.

My husband and I waited 3 weeks to get ribs from here and I will say it was worth the wait. Some of the best food I've ever had. Such a great place! We will for sure be back. Give the chef a hug for such great food!!!
Best BBQ around! This place is fantastic!  Ribs were melt in your mouth....had to fight the hubby for some brisket. ..definitely coming back

Updated- spoke with the owner this afternoon and had a great conversation. He was a man of his word and refunded me my money but was also concerned with the atmosphere at his restaurant. That's real leadership at the ownership level. I updated to four stars as the service can out weigh good food any day of the week. 

Friday night kids are with babysitter and we stop to eat at Billy's. Worst $41 ever spent. The food was not even close to famous dave's as they compared and they bragged and stated everything was fresh and homemade. The cobbler was gross. Portions were super tiny that it made the meal look like a children's meal. I'm a grown adult and to have a small ice cream bowl for an order of Mac and cheese. They stared and brought us the cobbler five minutes after starting to eat. Stay away from here. The chicken was over salty and the brisket was gross and dry.

All I can say is WOW! It is about time that a BBQ that cares about their product opened up on the Westside. Tried the Brisket (Fatty Version), Ribs, Beans and Mac and Cheese. All were outstanding. If you are not into a healthy portion of fat, make sure to order the regular Brisket. (Yes you have a choice!) Sauces were good, sides were good, service was good albeit a little bit of a wait for the good food to arrive. Skip the chains, this is the real deal.

I'm not the BBQ lover like my husband, but I go for him. This is the first time, I would go back alone again and again. I'm amazed at how good everything was the Brisket is outstanding my husband devoured the ribs, the bacon Mac and cheese, and Fried Pickle fries are a must. I would return for their cornbread and sweet butter just to take home for a snack it was heavenly!!! If you blink you might miss it, a little place on the corner of a strip mall. Great my mouth is watering and their closed on Sunday figures.

Ribs where okay...they had a very light smoke ring if at Ll. The texture of the rib was a little off like it was parboiled before smoking.  The fatty end brisket was delicious though. For sides we got Mac n cheese, baked beans, and Cole slaw. Nothing special about any of it...tasted like good old velveeta.

The Pitmaster sandwich is absolutely fabulous, from  the buttered buns, to the coleslaw, to the pulled pork and brisket.  Friendly staff with great service this is a must try place if you like barbecue.

My wife and I dined here on March 23. We ordered two full racks of ribs. They were delicious and the sides equally as good. My only "concern" was the ribs in question were not as advertised. Their menu lists Baby Back Pork ribs for sale. However, you do not get loin back ribs. What you get are more like St. Louis style pork spare ribs. Big difference.

Seriously not impressed... I would give 0 stars, if I could! I showed up at 5:30, and they were already out of brisket and chicken (4 hours before closing?? Really?). The gentleman in front of the register. Spent more time with his back turned to me. Than he did taking my order. Ok, whatever. I've dealt with bad service before. Then, I watched a line form in the dining room. While the same gentleman was in the kitchen, on his cellphone. When I finally did get my food, they were out of bbq sauce!!! In a BBQ restaurant?! You've got to be kidding me! Took my food home, to go. And what I got, was so underwhelming. The bun, my sandwich was on. Had so much butter on it. There was a puddle inside of the box. And the sandwich itself, the meat tasted like chili meat. Gross! Fries were undercooked and not good. I will not be returning! Immediately threw the food away, and went elsewhere for a real meal. Thanks a lot, Billy!

Billy's BBQ was nothing more then a disappointment. My wife and I decided to give it s shot after seeing all of the positive reviews on yelp, we were the only people there when we walked in and ordered to go. We both ordered 2 item combos my wife ordered lean brisket and pulled pork,  I ordered fatty brisket and spare ribs the sides were so lackluster I don't even remember what we ordered.  Anyway we got home with our food and sat down to eat we opened our containers to find that we were both given fatty brisket and I was given baby back ribs not spare ribs. How you get the order wrong with only 2 customers I don't know. And as for the food it was the smallest BBQ portions I have ever seen 3 thin slices of brisket and 4 baby back ribs or maybe an ice cream scoop size pile of pulled pork. The brisket tasted OK nothing special, the ribs tasted like they were cooked in the oven no smoke flavor what so ever and the pork was dry and tough. Even the cornbread that came with the meals was dry and unappealing. We will not be coming back.
Had a sampler platter but the hot links were out so had to add another ribs to fill for the links. The serving was big, me my wife and kids were sharing on it. It's a fast food BBQ place.
If you like paying $23 for a barbecue platter to open it up and see a nice long hair laying right on top-  then come eat here. No thank you. Enough said. So disgusted.

This place is 100% delicious and with affordable prices its top notch. My kids loved the Mac n Cheese with bacon! The sampler plate was more than enough to be shared. Staff was great and the owner came up to us to make sure we were satisfied. He was so attentive and it shows in his food and attitude that he truly cares. We will definitely be back!!

I really like this place and I'm glad I found a restaurant like Billy's to try authentic BBQ. I actually saw that they catered one of the UNLV basketball tailgate's and Yelped them after I saw comments on the post stating "I love Billy's." Normally I would of waited some time to try a place like them out because they are on the other side of town from me! Luckily the same day I Yelped them I needed to be in the area after work for an errand I needed to do.

Originally I was going to try the different taco options, however I was quit hungry so I opted for the 2 entree combo. In my combo I ordered the brisket and pulled pork with sides of corn bread and fried pickles. I am a fan of both of these meats whenever I can have it and Billy's version certainly did not disappoint. I truly tasted the smokey flavor in the brisket and this is something that differentiates real BBQ from all that other stuff. The smokey flavor was mild, but not too overwhelming. The funny part is that when I ordered the brisket, the cashier asked if I wanted a fatty piece or lean piece. I asked lean because I would of felt sick after eating an piece of fatty brisket. I guess that's how know their truly southern when they ask questions like that, haha! Billy's BBQ sauce was okay, if I'm not mistaken there's another review that feels the same way. The pulled pork was good too and was pretty standard. Although I was not amazed by it, I still did enjoy it. I have yet to find one that knocks my socks off. I think I would of enjoyed the pulled pork more in a sandwich? The corn bread was pretty amazing. It was really moist, which is difficult to do with corn bread considering corn meal is so course and try itself. I've corn bread from a ton of other places and theirs is probably one of the better versions. I'm sure the butter that came with it would of made it that much better, I'm trying to sort of cut down on calories. The fried pickles are not on the menu because it's the side special of the month. I read in another review the fried pickles compliments the BBQ well and I don't know if it does but they certain do taste good. I've never had fried pickles before, but I'm glad I tried it. It did not taste odd at all, but pretty good actually. I saw that in the condiment area there was this white sauce submerged in ice. The cashier explains that's their version of another of sauce and adds it's more a vinegar base. I tried it and it was different. It wasn't exactly bad tasting, but I wouldn't use it on my meat entrees the next time I come. It may be awhile till I come here again, but I will definitely recommend Billy's to my friends looking for a good BBQ spot. Please try them out, they deserve your business! To add to that the food here will not disappoint.

Very grateful that this place popped up in my facebook feed one day, I've been here 4-5 times since. Some of the best brisket I've ever had, awesome ribs, really good beans and the mac & cheese is pretty good too. If you like John Mull's Roadkill Grill, you will like this place too but it's much closer for those of us that live in the SW.

My wife and I  ordered the  brisket sandwich and ribs.   Both were dreadfully salty.  We're talking instant hypertension.   The dry, chopped brisket looks like it was originally encrusted with rock salt and peppercorns seasoning. The sweet potato waffle fires were burned, read cremated.  Baked beans were the best thing - but were offered at a very small size as a side item.   Had to throw it all away.   

The meat portion sizes was large, but I probably would not be here today if I ate this.

Amazing BBQ! The chicken is fabulous! Moist and rich in flavor. Best mac n cheese I have ever had. Great staff. Very clean restaurant. Worth the trip every time. We have tried a lot of BBQ in Vegas and Billy's BBQ by far is the best!

I recently got catering service from Billys BBQ, and I'll say the food was GREAT! I am an event coordinator for a property management company here in town, and our residents were thrilled with the food. This isn't the first time I've used Billy's and I will for sure keep going back. I did have to wait a bit for all the food to be ready but it was a lunch rush so I didn't fuss about it. Other than that, the food was great and service was good.
Great food and great service! Brisket was awesome and so were the sides of Mac n cheese, fried okra, collard greens and coleslaw! We got 2 complimentary deserts! Would definitely come here again!

We were actually headed to Fuddrucker's when we saw this place and decided to try it...glad we did! We ordered the 3 meat plate with brisket, pulled pork, and pulled chicken. We chose baked beans, mac n' cheese, and cornbread for our sides. Everything was delicious!  All of the meats were very tender and flavorful. The sides were very good too. 2 of us shared the meal, and it was plenty. The BBQ master even came out to check on us. I heard they have free soft serve ice cream cones for dessert, but we were too stuffed to indulge!  I would rather eat BBQ from a place like this than one of the chain restaurants any day! It's a long drive for us from Henderson, but well worth it. We will be back!

Yum! We tried Billy's for the first time today. We are usually John Mulls regulars but it's so far from our house so we tried these guys out today and was not let down! First of all, the girl at the counter was super friendly. We got ribs, brisket, sausage, Mac and cheese and pickle fries. I am a brisket junkie and theirs was so good I had it for lunch then the leftovers for dinner later.  My fiancé LOVED the ribs! The servings were so huge he hasn't tried the sausage yet, so full!! The Mac and cheese was creamy but not soupy. I usually say leave bacon to breakfast but I really liked it in there. The pickle fries are a must try! They were crispy when we got home which normally doesn't happen since they steam in the takeout boxes. Their sauces are a little too vinegar heavy for my liking but that's just preference. Definitely try it out if you're in the area!

good stuff.  bark on the brisket was excellent and the meat was moist and tender.  pulled pork also had great flavor and bark.  beef sausage was my favorite.  natural casing, excellent snap. seriously good stuff.   the hot BBQ sauce has the perfect amount of spice.  the beans are killer too.  corn bread was just ok.

Just went for 1st time with my girls & Mom- had the pulled pork sandwich, pulled chicken sandwich & the ribs--- everything was great!! Yummy tasting Bbq sauces & sides! We will return very soon- especially when my oldest hears about it! We are Bbq lovers, roadkill grill is usually a fave but Billy's BBQ is right around the corner. Cornbread is really good too!! Next time I'll try the Mac & cheese.

I stopped in with some friends for a late dinner with some friends. What immediately caught my eyes were the BBQ Tacos given I figured that would an interesting unique item to eat. I ordered a trio, the Smoked Brisket, Pulled Pork, and Smoked Chicken for my tacos, and we shared some sweet potato fries. Both the Brisket and Pork tacos were $2.75, and the chicken was $2.50, and the small sweet potato fries cost $2.50.

I liked the tacos, each having their pros and cons. I ate the pulled pork taco first and the meat was good, and they put plenty of the of it in the taco. However, the coleslaw, which I liked, was very saucy. The taco quickly became drenched and sauce just kept dripping out at each bite. The pork was tender and had good flavor. Three Stars..

The Brisket taco came with tender smokey beef, but the meat had to much salt. To make sure, I pulled out of few pieces of brisket to eat on its own, and yes unfortunately is was the meat. This taco also came with the good coleslaw and suffered from the same heavy sauce. Three Stars...

The Smoked Chicken taco was my by far my favorite. It came with an abundant of tender plump pieces of flavor juicy chicken. This too had a lot of sauce from the coleslaw, but the sheer amount of tasty chicken, quickly made up for that. Great taco and an easy four stars.

The sweet potato fries were good. They had a nice crispy exterior and soft center and were well seasoned. Service was hit and miss. It was friendly and efficient at the counter, but there not able to get our food to the table simultaneously, so we politle waited for everyone to have their orders, before we began to eat. 

In the end, everything was okay, but it doesn't mean it could of been better.

Okay...if my hunch is right and there is an afterlife, when I get there (assuming it is heaven) I plan to spend the first ten thousand years or so eating Billy's brisket.  
Holy cow can these guys cook cow. It is fork-tender, perfectly smoked, and lined with just the right amount of fat.  It is...well...perfect!

I cannot count the number of times I have gone to lesser BBQ joints for brisket and received something dry, thinly sliced, overly smoked, and chewy.  It is a real treat to find a place that understands how to make it right.  You guys are the super ninja, transformer robot, Obi Wan Kenobis of beef and I salute you.   Now for the intervention...

You guys have mastered the whole meat thing, and are doing our nation's long history of BBQ proud.  But what is up with the fake tea?  What BBQ bureaucrat in your organization tasted this stuff and said to himself, "Oh yeah, this will be the perfect complement for the world's best brisket!" (Insert rhetorical pause here...)

BBQ, more than any other food, cries out for freshly brewed tea.  Great BBQ masters around the country spend years perfecting their craft, and see fit to accompany it with such condiments as sliced bread, dill pickles, and real "brewed" iced tea. Serving brisket such as yours with soda fountain tea is like serving a perfectly prepared prime filet with Spaghetti O's!  Yeah...I know...now that I have written it, it sounds kind of good...but never mind that...  

You really need to understand the travesty here.  We live in a world that is full of McNuggets, Gorditas, Velveeta, artificial flavors, MSG, and Wolfgang Puck restaurants.  BBQ, on the other hand, is real. It takes us back to our forefathers, out on the open range, cooking meat with fire.  It is food at its purest, and part of our American story! How can that rich heritage be accompanied with tea flavored drink?  It is wrong...almost immoral.

Look, you have done the BBQ-eating world a great service with your outstanding brisket, ribs, and fried okra but you have fallen into fast food purgatory with your simulated iced tea. It does your great food a sad disservice.  On behalf of BBQ lovers everywhere, I implore you to dump the tea-like brown liquid and realize your true potential. Your fifth star awaits! It is within your grasp...carpe diem!

The staff was friendly and Rick, the owner, went above and beyond to show me southern hospitality. The beans are amazing! The sprinkled brisket in the beans takes it above and beyond.  The ribs are fall off the bone fantastic. I like the dry rub on the ribs rather then covering up the taste of delicious meat in sauce. Rick gave me a juicy tidbit of information that peach cobbler was coming to the menu soon. I can't wait to come back and try that next. I have shrimp and links to still try along with some of the sides like fried okra. My favorite sauce was the tangy sauce. It's interesting because it's not thick and it's different than anything else I have ever tried. It adds a oompf to the meat so it really does make a delicious accompaniment.

Billy's BBQ was delicious! We tried the chicken and pulled pork street tacos which were delicious, pickle fries which were good, cornbread (was sweet which was a nice change), super Mac bowl which was our favorite, bacon Mac n cheese which was good, ribs which were falling off the bone and were not over cooked, and coleslaw (too peppery for my taste, but the boyfriend loved it). They were out of brisket so we will definitely come back to try that along with the sausage!

BBQ in Las Vegas is pretty much Non existent, well ever since Buzz BBQ closed their doors that is.. They fell victim to the "we gotta get bigger" syndrome. With that being said when I walked through Billy's doors I was beyond happy to see it was a smaller restaurant. Low overhead, no fancy decorations, and no wait staff... This is important because places who fall victim to the "we gotta get bigger" syndrome usually fail quick in this town.... 
    I decided a 3 meat combo was in order to see how Billy's does BBQ. I ordered the Brisket, Pulled Pork, and sausage with smoked mac n cheese and fried pickle fries... I knew I was at a TRUE BBQ place when I was asked how I like my brisket, fatty or lean.. The Second giveaway that I was in good BBQ hands was NO SAUCE on my meat!!!!!! Amen Billy's!!!!!!!! I do like sauce but I'd like to taste the meat and decide for myself if it needs any... I tasted the meats and decided they didn't need any sauce, until I tried a spoon of their hot BBQ sauce. It's more of a vinegar based sauce that's not sloppy sticky and sweet. The perfect compliment to pulled pork. Both the pulled pork and brisket were some of the best I've had in Vegas( yes, even better than buzz) the sausage wasn't my favorite but I'm not here for sausage. The fried pickles and smoked Mac n cheese were delicious! My wife got Baked beans and slaw for her sides and loved them both. 
    I hope Billy's never catches the dreaded "We gotta get bigger" syndrome and just continues pumping out tasty BBQ. If your food is good enough people will wait!!! I'm excited to add this restaurant to my favorites but will remain cautious because us Las Vegan's have been burned by Q one too many times.

Billy and his BQQ...

Located along West Flamingo, the restaurant is a few doors down from the children hairdressers Snip Clips.

A nice casual atmosphere, Billy's is an inviting restaurant and friendly staff and a nice aroma will get your engines salivating! When walking in take a sharp left and join the line up.

I can recommend:
 - Tacos: (chicken, pork, beef) they have a wicked Homemade coleslaw that really is something to try!
- Baked Beans: these are the best BBQ baked beans in Vegas. It's a big claim, however I'll stand by it till I sample better.

Service is quick, friendly and well worth the trip!
Ah before I forget take out is also available.

Overall:
Food: 4-5
Drink: 3-5
Service: 4-5
Coming back: Yes

Famous Dave's who? Never heard of him! Our 1st time trying Billy's & hands down was the Best American BBQ in Las Vegas that we've tried so far. The Pulled Chicken & Pulled Pork were so tender & flavorful especially when dipped in that Vinegar Mustard Liquid Sauce that is located near the drinks. If you are from Guam like I am its like a good Finadene! The Spare Ribs were fall off the bone tender. Good Sweet Potato Waffle Fries, Tangy Creamy Cole Slaw, Delicious Baked Beans, Soft Bread & Butter & even the Deviled Eggs are yummy. They gave you one Deviled Egg on your platter which is a nice touch offering you a different texture while enjoying your BBQ platter. One star off for not offering homemade Sweet Tea. I love me some Sweet Tea with Lemon! Washing down your BBQ with Sweet Tea go hand in hand & homemade Sweet Tea tastes even better. Sweet Tea is offered but it wasn't made in house so I opted for water. I also saw on their Instagram that last year that Fried BBQ Shrimp was offered but I didnt see it on the menu yesterday. Bring back that shrimp cause it looked Delish! Lucky us we scored some complimentary Peach Cobblers yesterday & it was awesome! Suggestion- Strawberry Shortcake would make for a yummy dessert as well & surprisingly hardly any other American BBQ places offer that dessert. Service was good! Anyways, Billy's isn't located near me at all but the Hubby proclaimed "I am not eating at any other BBQ place again". So with that said Billy's has gained 2 more customers & I will spread the word starting with Yelp. Go get your American BBQ on! Go get some! I promise that you will forget all about that Dave guy.

I am a big fan of Billy's BBQ from the first time I locked my jaws on some of there Brisket. This  is the best BBQ in all of Las Vegas. I know that is not saying much but I feel this place can pretty much hold it's own anywhere it might have been built. So why only 4 stars. I have been there 4 or 5 times and occasionally consistency is an issue. Not a very big issue but still an issue. If you go a recommend the Brisket highly. After that most everything else i have had is good. Start with the brisket and work backwards. I will also let you know most of the side i have had here are good as well. I recommend the cornbread and the brisket baked beans. The one thing I wasn't a fan of was the Banana pudding as it was just okay at best. 

Looking for real BBQ in Vegas just go hear and stop wasting your time else where.

Finally great BBQ in the southwest. Pulled pork and fatty cut brisket are awesome. Fried okra and Mac n cheese as sides. Everything is so good and huge portions. Two people can share a two meat ate with brisket it's so much food! Have to come and try.

Cute place, good food...what they had of it. By 6:15, they were out of chicken, brisket and ribs. So I had a pulled pork sandwich. No complaints on that. But why on earth would they be out of 3 out of 5 of their menu choices early on a Friday night? I can only imagine that something must have happened that was beyond their control because certainly a business cannot survive if this is a routine occurrence. That said, I would give them a second chance because the pulled pork was very good and I like that they serve the meat undressed. You select which sauce, if any you would like to use. I know others have raved about the mac n' cheese, but I was not too fond of it because the macaroni was too firm, almost chewy and the cheese was like a runny cheese sauce similar to the consistency of nacho cheese sauce that you get at the fast food places. It also did not have enough flavor for my taste. I like mac n' cheese made with a sharper cheese, preferably cheddar and this seemed like it may have been made with mild cheese or american cheese.

I also liked that they had many different root beers to choose from. I ordered one and was not asked what kind of root beer I wanted, so they must have one for people who don't specify a brand. I can't remember the name of the one I was given. It was ok, sweet but not very strong.

Considering the bad news the person taking the orders had to convey to the customers, he was still courteous and able to smile throughout the dreaded task delivering the "we are out of" news to the customers before they ordered to minimize the risk of unhappiness. If he had not been so nice, I think I would have been a little more perturbed.

Finally being able to stop in and we're not disappointed!! Brought the whole family in, whole racks of ribs and sides. The pickle fries were to die for and so were the brisket baked beans!!! The owner Billy was here brought us some samples of the whole beef sausage, mmm delish. Will be back again soon!! =)
This is a really great barbecue place! Omg!! Im sooo in love with the Pluckin' & Cluckin!  They serve this pulled chicken sandwich the best topped with their homemade coleslaw!!

Previously, i recommended Billy's to everyone. Went in today and its all changed. The beans are nothing like they used to be. They now taste like canned beans with some meat tossed in. And the brisket is all different.  Nowhere near as much smoke flavor. Its also somewhat dried out. Coleslaw now tastes like typical store bought stuff unlike the vinegar based slaw they used to have. The mac and cheese bowl is like commercial mac and cheese and not the rich, creamy, smokey mac and cheese they used to have. Also no more bacon in the mac and cheese.  Again the brisket was bland with little smoke flavor and pieces of dried meat. The pickle fries seem to be the same as is the dipping sauce. You can no longer fill your own bbq sauce cups to go. You have to ask for them to fill sauce for you. Also the sauces have changed. The vinegar based sauce is almost all vinegar and little smoke or spice. Severely disappointed.  Don't know if I will be going back. They had a sign posted that they are changing the menu. Basically adding deviled eggs, collard greens,  crinkle cut fries, peach cobbler, strawberry shortcake. Looks like they are not going to have shrimp anymore either.

We ordered pulled pork, brisket, and barbecue ribs. For sides, we ordered fried okra, pickle fries, and sweet potato fries. The pulled pork was dry, the brisket was too salty, but the ribs were perfect- tender meat that fell right off the bone, perfectly seasoned, and delicious overall. The fries were good, very crispy, but in combination with the free cone of soft serve vanilla ice cream, they made us gassy. Overall, okay BBQ place.

This is a typical BBQ, order at the counter, get your own drink and wait for your food layout that I've experienced in newer restaurants in Salt Lake City, Florida and now Las Vegas this year. Our group ordered the pulled pork sandwiches and I had a half rack of the baby back ribs.  The pulled pork portions were generous for $8.95. The half rack was 6 bones which I thought was a little light for $15.99.  The meat was moist, great smoke flavor and done perfectly.  The sides: fried okra - everyone gave 2 thumbs up,  cole slaw - very good, nothing edgy, plain cole slaw with a Marzetti's like dressing, can't go wrong with that, smoked mac and cheese with bacon was loved by 2 of our group and not by the other.  I thought it was well executed with the cheese tasting like a heavily smoked gouda and the bacon adding a nice salty touch.   The BBQ sauces were a slight disappointment being very syrupy.  There were 3: original (very sweet), smoky (almost as sweet as original) and really redundant since the meat was smoked perfectly and a Tennessee hot which was thin and I really didn't enjoy even though spicy is my thing.   The restaurant was clean with kind of an Ikea meets Dixie awkward décor with cliché country music blaring.  I found it amusing because the food was very good.

We were craving BBQ and thought we would give this place a try. We ordered the chicken, brisket and ribs. The girl that took our order was chomping her gum so badly it was irritating.  We did not care for any of it. My son took one bite of the no flavor chicken and took the rest home and fed it to the dogs. My husband thought the brisket was ok, and the baby back ribs were just ok. Not good enough for us to return.

I love this place. I went there for the first time and was greeted with excellent service. The briskett is AWESOME!!!! I tasters the cornbread, Mac and cheese, and beans and they were all very tasty. The beans especially!!! A must try! The BBQ in Vegas is lackluster at best, thiß is s nice refreshing new place to try.

After reading the reviews,I was pretty excited to try Billy's.I was in the area with a craving for BBQ so I placed a to go order It was below average across the board. I ordered a half lb. of brisket,a half lb. of pork, a large Mac and,a small slaw, and a mini loaf of bread.

Brisket: I ordered 1/2 lean and 1/2 fatty. I was expecting slices of brisket,what I received was what looked like a bunch of scraps. It brought nothing to the table. Dried out and bland (which was weird because there was a big pool of grease at the bottom of the container 

Pork: usually it's chopped or pulled. This was presented as a few big , seriously dried out chunks. Even after dunking in the sauces (which were actually good and almost saved the sub par meat) it was seriously chewy and took work to choke down.

Mac and cheese: Dried out a bit. Not terrible,not special.

Slaw, I didn't try it, my wife had a couple bites and the rest went in the trash

Mini loaf of bread. Pretty stale- like it had been sitting in a steam drawer all day

Complimentary cobbler. Had a few good bites,again seemed old. Would not have paid for it

I'm not sure if it was the time I ordered (7pm) but everything was dried out or stale. It didn't seem like there was any pride taken in this food, and that makes me sad. The good news is the sauce is decent and the lady behind the counter was friendly. Those were the two reasons it's not a one star.

IDK what was so amazing about this place as other yelpers are saying. I am giving this place a 2 1/2 star because, yes the service was nice but the food was not good at all.. I was craving for sole bbq, i was thinking to go to Famous Daves, but decided to give this place a shot, since it pulled up on my yelp and it had 4 stars! Ha ... We had the ribs with 2 sides.. The mac n cheese and the beans. The ribs were very tasteless and dry... despite they put the sauce on top! I had to mix sauces that were on the table to TRY to give it some flavor... The mac/cheese with the crispy bacon was baked and a little somewhat burnt. IDK what was "too die for" about it as previous stated by the other yelper! The beans weren't good either. It was kind of disappointing to have my hopes up to taste some bomb ass bbq, seeing it as a 4 star but then yet turn out to be gross! Oh and they also were giving out peach/cherry/chocolate cobblers complimentary.  When they bought it to the table... Was hoping at least this would be at least good.. "It looked good and was hot" ... One taste of it... I just got up and left!

This is our first time here and the food is amazing, the service not so much! The mac n cheese with brisket is HEAVEN.. I would Have given 5 stars, but the lovely lady who took our to go order was a lovely...biotchh. Myself and husband have been in the service industry for 10 plus years. My husband is the nicest person so for him to be so offended by her attitude says a lot. She was Hawaiian looking girl with shorter dark hair. I'd love to be a return customer for this yummy food, but not if we have to deal with bad service. I won't let one bad seed ruin my opinion unless it happens again.

Super friendly staff. Superb food made with care and love. The pulled pork and the brisket (ask for lean cut) melt in your mouth. Three homemade sauces, all unique and tasty.
Delicious sides (mac 'n' cheese with bacon and baked beans are maybe the best on the menu).

I heard good things about the brisket here. When they ask you if you want it lean or fatty, you know you're in a spot that knows how brisket should be served. So, I ordered a half pound of brisket and a link of brisket sausage. I wasn't a huge fan of the sausage, but it was still eaten. The brisket was cooked very well. My only gripe is that I feel the brisket could have had a bit more smoke added. The bark would have been 5x better. The sauce was a bit too vinegar based, so i didn't really care for it much. Billy's is probably the best spot in Vegas, along with Rollin' Smoke.

This place has such great food!!! I had the sausage..fabulous!! Brisket..fabulous!!! The shrimp I did not order, my husband  ordered shrimp took a bite & next weekend I was back with a bucket of shrimp!!!! Best shrimp I have ever tasted!!! Corn bread/ butter yummy!!!! The people working here are very friendly!!! Waitress's we had to day was great! Only reason I did not give this place 5 stars...they run out of food!

This is some of the best bbq I've had. Their food is cooked to quantity so when they run out for the day you gotta come again next time. 

Their platter are enough for two people and then some. My husband and I wanted to sample everything so it was a great option. They serve their meat with no extras and I like how it's not slathered in sauce so you can really taste the grill. 

The banana parfait was yum also! I'll definitely be back.
Great location and best BBQ in town! It's nice to know this place will take care of your concerns and provides great customer service. Thank you

My husband and I have been to Billy's a few times now and have tried a variety of items on the menu and we love the food here. The meats are all cooked perfectly and seasoned well. Each time we go we try a different side. The baked beans are so good as well as the cornbread and honey butter. My husband loves the beef brisket. He lived in Kansas City so he's very picky about BBQ. I recommend getting the plate with 3 meat choices. That way you can try a few things and get a couple of sides. It is a very big helping so you can share or take it home for later. Don't waste your time going to a mediocre BBQ chain restaurant when you have Billy's right across the street.
1st in and asked for what they thought I should try.  Went with the fatty brisket and ribs with a Mac and cheese side.  Ton of food so I didn't finish everything, but it all was great. Nice job.

Unfortunately Yelp only allows me to leave one star instead of zero. My friends and I came into Billy's tonight on a Friday night and it was completely empty. I spent over $30 on a meal that was soggy and the meat was dried out. It felt like I spent money on cafeteria food, I could've gone to KFC and got more for my money. I will never come back again.

It's hard to find a good authentic bbq place in Vegas but I finally found it. I had the pulled pork sandwich and it was huge and delicious. The Mac and cheese with bacon was like a little bowl of heaven. So yummy!! Service was great. The staff came out and offered free cherry cobbler to everyone in the restaurant!

Good meaty baby back ribs, done just right   Tender but with good bite off the bone. Sauce is tasty. Mac and cheese was creamy, cheesy and really good. Next time I'll try the link; unfortunately, they had temporarily run out! Billy was there busy running food to tables but stopped to introduce himself and apologize for not having any link. I'll be back!
For the price, quality, and location, you honestly can't beat Billy's!  Absolutely on par with some of the "best" bbq places around town.

Wow this hit the spot. I had the brisket sandwich.  They have great smokey flavor to their meat.  Portion size was good. What really topped it off for me was the smoked mac n cheese with bacon. Pretty light on the bacon, but my goodness, nice, thick, creamy mac n cheese. It was absolutely delicious!

AHHHHMAZING bbq.  I'm not even really a BBQ fan as I think most BBQ restaurants overcook the meat and smother with BBQ sauce.  Totally not the case here.  Had the brisket and it was incredible.  We completely scarfed it down in minutes ... I will definitely be back here very soon!

Signage made it difficult to find my first time; passed it almost three times. Tacos are a bit small, but just right for me. Guys probably need to order 2 or 3. But worth the effort. The pulled pork was absolutely scrumptious!   Best we've tasted in town. We'll be back to try the brisket.  The restrooms were nice & CLEAN.

The service was OUTSTANDING!
The ribs were the kind that I love----fall right off of the bone! Mac-N-Cheese with crispy bacon was to die for!
Chez in the kitchen knows his BBQ! 
Thanks ya'll ! 
I will be bringing my family back there for sure!

Finally made it over. Food was delicious. Highly recommend the tacos and loved the brisket. Already craving more and look forward to a return visit. I'll be frequenting Billy's for the foreseeable future. Thanks, Billy.

Compared to Famous Dave's it sucks. Plastic plates & utensils & everything was mediocre. My half-a-rack of ribs were equal to a quarter rack of Famous Dave ribs! (I do realize I'm comparing Baby Back w/ Spare Ribs, but none-the-less tiny portion!) Billy's honey butter taste like sweetened whipped shortening, definitely not real butter; gross!! The sauces were ok but the white BBQ sauce was tasty w/ the fries. Mac & cheese sucks; dry & flavorless. The corn bread was way too sweet, more like cake! Skip Billy's and stick with Famous Dave's or venture to Road Kill grill for real outdoorsy BBQ!!
I have one major complaint about Billy's BBQ, and its that they are going to make me fat because the food and dessert is so delicious that you don't want to stop eating it and the staff is amazing.

The services are 5*. Friendly, smile. Food is another 5*, side dishes are out of this world. Freshness of coleslaw, crunchy of Sweeney potato fries, bake beans has smoky pork within, cornbread is firmed and sweet. Let's don't forget the sweet happiness of "FREE" ice cream cone.

And it is not far from home. I definitely recommend this BBQ place to everyone.

Wow...in a city like Las Vegas, there's always going to be too many places to eat...but the good thing is that there's only a FEW places that are actually GOOD!  Finding good barbecue in Las Vegas shouldn't be a task, but it can be.  Some places I have gone to were essentially in really sketchy parts of the city whereas others were way up in North Las Vegas in areas of undeveloped land that had odd hours of operation.

Thankfully, the most heavenly of barbecue restaurants came to me by randomly putting in a Google search of nearby BBQ places in the Summerlin area.  I have to say, it definitely deserves a spot in the Top 5 even Number 1 if possible! Many reviews said that Billy's BBQ was primarily a 'eat til it's gone' type of place; once the available meats are all gone, they're gone.  But that is often to be expected especially when it comes to BBQ.  I accepted this fact and figured I should still give it a shot, who knows?  Given the fact that the photos other reviewers had uploaded were making my mouth water, I knew that was a sign that I had to try it!

My fiancee and I went there on a Friday night to find it tucked away in a nice area of a major shopping plaza on Flamingo and the 215. Walking in, the place reminded me of the Capriotti's in Downtown Summerlin.  Somewhat small in terms of width, but very tall in height.  Seating appeared to hold roughly 18-25 people.

The photo that enticed me the most was a signature dish of Billy's and that was their BBQ shrimp.  I have always loved fish but shrimp was something I never got into until I was about 9 or 10.  I didn't like the idea of fish that was crunchy.  Shrimp to me always felt weird when I bit into it and heard an audible 'crunch' sound.  But I got into it more as I got older and now it's one of my favorite fish to eat.  I'd tried shrimp of wide varieties over the years, grilled, pan fried, stir fried, popcorn, coconut, shrimp toast, shrimp po-boy...listen to me! I'm starting to sound like Bubba from Forrest Gump!  But, truth be told, I had NEVER had BBQ shrimp before!  The photos shown made it look absolutely incredible so I knew I had to try it.  Another thing I have always loved is baked beans.  BBQ baked beans can go one of two ways with me; incredibly delicious or absolutely tasteless.  The look of photos depicting Billy's brisket baked beans looked to be a winner, so I knew I would be ordering those as well.  Finally, the last item that enticed me was Billy's pickle fries.  I have eaten deep-fried pickles before at Buffalo Wild Wings where they serve them sliced as 'Pickle Chips', but what Billy's does is serve them as spears so they more closely resemble fries, hence the name 'Pickle Fries'.

Many reviews recommended that you call ahead and find out exactly what the restaurant is currently out of, especially if you're planning to call after 4-5 PM.  Justin, the owner was nice enough when greeting us as new customers to let us know what he still had available for the night.  This night he was out of ribs which my fiancee and I are big fans of, but we accepted this, me especially since I knew what I wanted was still available.  My fiancee ordered another Billy's signature dish, the 'Super Mac'; an interesting concoction of mac and cheese with brisket, barbecue sauce, and pieces of bacon.  She also ordered one of their hot links which is smoky beef sausage.  With two drinks, altogether our meal cost roughly $29.00.

I had read online that the restaurant serves a wide variety of root beers from around the world, but I decided to leave that for another time.  I am not a mega huge fan of root beer, but I do enjoy sampling different beverages from other countries.  Plus, they have a Pennsylvania staple from when I was a kid, Birch Beer!  I will definitely have to try that the next time I go!

When we sat down, the time it took to get our meal was minimal, we did not request them to bring out everything all at once, nor did we ask them to bring out whatever was ready when it was ready, but we got our main courses first.  The bbq shrimp...let me tell you something...I knew this plate looked appetizing in pictures...but to actually taste it...wow.  They also did something very helpful which was to remove the tails before throwing them into the deep fryer.  I hate, hate, HATE having to use caution when eating fried shrimp not knowing because of the breading, whether to eat the thing whole or to only eat up to the tail area for fear that the shell will still be attached.  NOT AT BILLY'S! The whole shrimp, in the mouth, and pure savory barbecue delicousness!  With a hint of spiciness thrown in as well! The beans? Exquisite! Pickle fries? Out of this world! I even tried my fiancee's plates and again, equally astounding!

I would write more but I'm getting that "wrap it up" notice, so I'll just say, try Billy's BBQ and I guarantee, you will be back again!  I myself actually ended up ordering from them again the VERY NEXT DAY!

Til next time Billy's!

Ugh...730pm we're sold out of chicken.  We're sold out of sausages...all i kept hearing is we're out...not a great first time experience!  There are way too many other choices in  the area that are not sold out of food of what I want....Sorry Billy, I won't be back!

Really good BBQ place probably my favorite in town. 

I got the super Mac bowl /w Brisket.  The smoky flavor was great better then I have had in this town so far. My wife got the brisket sandwich. The portion is pretty large she enjoyed it and wouldn't share!  The two meat plate is huge when you are wanting a lot of food or looking to share a meal this would be your go to. You get two choices of their delicious BBQ. 

On to the sides the sweet potato fries were nothing to rave about they were just sweet potato fries. The Mac was really creamy as a side. Adding the  bacon really gives it that BBQ flavor we crave. The corn bread and cinnamon butter are really good. The corn bread is a sweet corn bread almost like cake with a little bit of that grit you expect from corn bread.  when you add the cinnamon butter it's great even as a dessert. I recommend getting that as a side. 

The banana pudding was really thick pudding with good tasting bananas, and traditional vanilla wafers through out still crunchy. The only thing I would add is a homemade cream on top and not the ready whip. Still it's a great and a good addition for something sweet.  


The down side we had to wipe off our own tables. There was some sticky BBQ sauce left over from the last group of people enjoying their meal.  The bottles were also sticky to touch and made it a little less enjoyable, but still 5 stars. 

Go try this place! I'm sure you will be back.

I tried the pork and the brisket. Very well made and the flavor is good. Most places has their meat smothered in BBQ sauce or super salty from the rub. It was a perfect amount of smokey flavored deliciousness. 

 I'm not a big fan of fried pickles but it complimented the pork and brisket very well!!
Billy asked me if I wanted lean or fatty slices on my brisket.    It's almost like a trick question.   The answer is yes.

I lived in the South for a few years, and I have eaten at 4 different BBQ joints in Las Vegas. I have eaten at Billy's 5 times now. For various reasons, Billy's BBQ is as close to authentic southern BBQ as it comes.

Smokey flavor-
Any BBQ aficionado would agree that the flavor is in the meat, not the sauce. Billy's has got it down. All of their meats are smoked in high-end equipment that cooks the meat evenly and injects the smokey flavor throughout, so that each bite is packed full of delicious flavor.

Quality meat-
What good is smokey flavor on bad meat? Billy's does not disappoint. The chicken, brisket, pork, sausage, and ribs are all so juicy and tender. The meat falls off the bone, and retains its succulent moistness.

Awesome sauces-
BBQ sauces are enjoyed subjectively. One person may prefer tangy vinegar, while the other may prefer sweet and savory. Billy's offers a variety homemade sauces, each appealing to these different preferences.

Amazing sides-
Pickle fries, southern mac n' cheese, brisket baked beans, sweet cornbread, and much more. I haven't had a side yet that I haven't thoroughly enjoyed.

Do yourself a favor and come check this place out. It does NOT disappoint.

Went to Billy's for dinner tonight at around 5:15. Was told that they were out of ribs. Very disappointing. I went to a BBQ place for dinner and they were out. Ordered the brisket. It was very good. My wife ordered the pulled chicken sandwich and a 1/2 pound of chicken. As we waited we heard the staff say they were on the verge of being out of sweet potato fries and chicken. As customers I don't think we should hear about the shortcomings as we sit in the dining area awaiting our food. Apparently they found some chicken. Our order was delayed while waiting on the chicken. I watched our order go from bagged and ready to go, to removed from the bag and placed back under the heating lamp. As the food sat, the bun (chicken sandwich) became very soggy... I also ordered the Mac and cheese with bacon bits. Sounded really good. Only problem was there was literally 3 tiny pieces of bacon (yes three) in the Mac and cheese. Overall very disappointed in my experience. Plenty of other BBQ places in the valley that will get my business.
They need to bring bring back the waffle fries an get rid of those regular fries.The good was good.

Being from Georgia, I always try out new BBQ places. Not only does Billy's have the best brisket I've had in Las Vegas, it may be the best I've ever had. Nice big portion sizes, too. Daja, the cashier, was extremely friendly and helped me decide what to try, and her recommendations were great! I will absolutely be back, with friends!

Great place for BBQ!! Quick service and food came out right away!!! No wait and it was on a saturday afternoon! 
I had the sample plater, it came with a little bit of everything from chicken to a very tasty brisket
I would definitely recomend this place!!
Mediocre BBQ ribs, good brisket. Ribs tasted parboiled and had no flavor. Sides were bland.
First time here, friendly service, tried the sampler platter and I like the bread and everything.. i wasnt fine with the collard greens taste weird but other than that taste good

Small BBQ place near Target, Kohls and Jcpenney. Everyone that works here is super friendly and cool. I can in around 2pm on a Sat and it was pretty dead. The people that worked there advised it picks up around 5pm. 

My husband and I ordered the ribs. Which are PORK. My husband usually only likes beef ribs. The ribs were great, they were smokey, slathered in BBQ sauce and the meat came off nicely. They had a nice rub on them which made the flavor really unique. My husband loved them! It came with corn bread and coleslaw as well. The coleslaw was a big hit and we both ate our servings of it. 

We also ordered the pulled chicken sandwhich. It is seasoned pulled chicken on a toasted bun. They do not put sauce on it which I did not prefer. The meat was good but not anything to write home about. 

We wanted to order the banana pudding and they advised they were out. Kind of bummed but it was all good. We were surprised when we were about half way done with our food one of the cooks came out and said they actually had some banana pudding and brought it out to us! It was really nice of them and unexpected. It was great. 

Overall pleasant place to eat and good food.

Hate to do this but I have to downgrade the place. My last few times have been disappointing, to say the least. Dry meat and sausage. Sides that are bland. Even the brisket isn't done as well. It's all chopped up to hide the lack of quality. 
The service is always good, but I have idea what happened to the food. I do notice the owner hasn't been there the last few times I've gone. Maybe he's letting others take the lead and they're not as interested in quality.
Had the brisket and the brisket baked beans. Perfect smoke and the beans were amazing. We will be back. When you find a place this good you don't stop going. It's worth it.

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 6/100***

We were in the mood for some BBQ so we thought what better time to try the newly opened Billy's BBQ. I had high hopes for this place seeing that there had been several raves. We ordered the 3 meat combo with 2 sides. The pulled pork was ok, the brisket I was dissatisfied with. Maybe I was just expecting too much. All the flavors were there but the quality of the meat was inferior. They asked me if I wanted fatty or lean brisket and since I couldn't decide, the lady helping me suggested one of each. In less than 10 minutes our food was ready to go. I had a minor issue with the place seeming aloof, they didn't seem very friendly in welcoming customers and I found it offensive they would say bye to some patrons and not to some and in hindsight we were not even offered the "free" soft serve they have. But that's just me. 

So fast forward the drive home. I was disappointed when I saw the brisket, one piece was supposedly lean but it was still very fatty and the fatty piece was almost inedible. I thought it'd be just a little fat on top which with the right amount of char will add a flavor burst but it was big chunks and unpalatable. On the brighter side, all 3 sides we tried (mac and cheese, baked beans and honey cornbread) were on point in taste and texture.

Very rude staff. Walked in to get a to go menu and look over the menu to see what I wanted. So when I came back in there was a couple standing and blocking the counter that we(My mother & I) came to. So we said "excuse me", and proceeded to the counter. Immediately a staff member said "They're waiting on a to go order." in the rudest tone ever. So we just walked out. It was our first and last time at this establishment and I'm not coming back.
Our favorite bbq in Las Vegas. I love the macaroni and cheese, which is actually smoked and my husband loves the brisket and beans. The atmosphere is excellent and the prices are reasonable.

The restaurant was not busy when me and my bf got there. It was only a few people in there at the time, but that's a good thing. This place doesn't hold to many people. 

My and my Bf shared one order. We got the Sampler Platter, which cost us around $21.99
That meal included,1/4 lb each of pulled chicken, sliced brisket & pulled pork, 4 baby back ribs, 1 sausage, 2 small sides (Mac & Cheese w/ Bacon & Sweet Potato Fries) All I can say is, truly remarkable. 

Perfectly cooked meats!!  The flavors.... the flavors!! 

Though I would love to be selfish and keep Billy all to myself, the people has to know, the food is to dang good to stay hidden. There is no doubt, i'll be back.

Again, great service from Shari with excellent with great conversation. Greeted upon entry with a smiles from several employees.  

Lean brisket, bread, macaroni and cheese and cherry cobbler was fantastic tonight. Changes to the baked beans... Please have a no bacon option. The brisket baked beans were the reason to visit previously but now they have bacon.

I see many positive improvements at this business and appreciate good quality fresh foods.

BEST BBQ I'VE HAD IN LAS VEGAS! A friend of mine and I are avid BBQ fans and he discovered this place a few months ago, raved about it, and kept telling me I had to eat there. Well today we met up for lunch and he suggested we stop by and I agreed. 

The place has a very simple, minimalistic decor...nothing really special there. Open ceiling, a few TVs on the wall...nothing much. What it lacks in ambiance it makes up for in taste and it does so in a HUGE way.

I split the 3-meat platter with my buddy (MORE than enough food for the two of us) and we each got a BBQ taco as well. The tacos were simple but yummy...great shredded pork with cole slaw...good stuff, but the meat platter was to die for!

We got sausage, ribs, and fatty brisket. For sides, we got Bacon-Mac and Cheese and baked beans. First the sides...they were awesome! Mac and cheese was thick but not curdled. The bacon infusion was amazing and as good as that was, the baked beans were even better. A+

On to the meats...served nice and hot, the sausage was well cooked, just a little spicy, and very flavorful. The ribs fell right off the bone and complimented with their incredible BBQ sauce, they were spectacular. I feel as if I am a better human being now knowing a pig somewhere gave it's life for me to eat it in such a culinary delight. The brisket...it was like eating butter with meat flavor...it melted in your mouth. I'm salivating all over my keyboard at just the thought of one more bite of this delicious BBQ. 

If you're looking for some amazing BBQ food at very reasonable prices, you simply must stop by Billy's. It will make you think that Famous Daves and Tony Romas is nothing but 2nd rate dog food!

Went with no expectations, considering I haven't had much luck with bbq places in Summerlin. 

We ordered 30 min before closing and the girl taking the order informed us that the brisket was now down to the fatty ends, which was great to know because we would have been very disappointed...

However, I still ordered the sampler platter just to try it all, the chicken was delicious!!  It was tender and it didn't even need bbq sauce. 
(Couldn't tell the difference between the sauces)
The sausage lacked flavor, but I  am excited to try it again during the day when everything is available.

 Service was great, I don't remember her name but she was sweet.
Cute and fun atmosphere with an exceptionally friendly staff!  I had the brisket sandwich and mac n cheese, they were both soo good and comforting!

Went here for a second time. The two girls working the counter/food prep seemed more into making conversation than making food. I waited 25 mins for my food. I know BBQ takes a little longer but that is still a pretty ridiculous time (4 tacos side of small baked beans) the tortillas of the tacos I'm assuming weren't warmed properly they were dry and seemed right out of the package. Baked beans were delicious but less brisket in them this time around. Still a clean restaurant and decor. The gutbuster and the ribs are supposed to be amazing but haven't tried them yet. Still a decent place to go.

Items Selected:
Fresh corn bread with homemade honey butter
Brisket Baked Beans
Mac & Cheese

Spicy Beef Sausage
