Truly a story of following one's passion, owner Billy Palmer a former lawyer turned pit-master at the bequest of legions of local fans, it was just prior to noon on Saturday that myself and two friends stopped into Billy's Bar-B-Que, and finding a large menu with no less than five smoked meats on offer it was with an 'all-in' approach that we invested our appetites, a half pound of each ordered along with three sides and drinks for just over $50 inclusive of tip and tax.

Founded on the motto of "Real Smoke, Real Flavor" and featuring what the small restaurant refers to as "Competition-Style" 'cue, the process at Billy's is much like that at recently launched Downtown Summerlin's Ribs & Burgers with counterside ordering and tableside service, but with more focus on BBQ than branding the experience is decidedly different, drinks freely refilled at a nearby fountain instead of languishing for water with All-You-Care-To-Eat Soft Serve replacing boozed-up, overpriced shakes.

Clearly focused on the ribs, a lightly mopped dry-rub variety ready to be treated to four additional house-made bottles of sauce including hot, original, smoke, and white, one would be hard pressed to name a better baby-back in the city and although both the pulled pork and chicken proved to be a bit of a disappointment with the former dried out and the later too modestly flavored to be memorable at all the beef options and sides to follow sang an entirely different tune...

Beginning first with the sides, suffice it to say that any beans that include almost as much beef as sauce are likely to be a success and with supple chunks of brisket juxtaposing the creamy red legumes the smoky sweet bowl was amongst the best I've ever had, the creamy macaroni also a well made rendition while the piping hot cornbread was the best 'slab' version in Las Vegas discovered to date - even before the addition of honey butter than further wet the crumb and brought both sweet and savory flavors to a head.

Saving the best to last, though in reality it was the first thing each of us consumed, both the house made beef sausage and, more so, the brisket were of reference standard quality - the former cited as too greasy by one member of the party but to my tastes absolutely perfect while the brisket, offered lean or fatty, was imbued by a thick smoke ring with light char on the surface giving way to the natural sort of flavor that did not require even a drop of sauce to shine - the sort of stuff that would make even a native Texan raise an eyebrow, whether they'd admit it or not.

Like several other Sin City BBQ pits, Billy's is the sort of place where selective ordering can yield the sort of smoked meat likely to impress purists and locals alike, and while not every option is equal the same can be said of any place in America - it's not like anyone is singing the praises of North Carolina Brisket, Texas Pulled Pork, or Kansas City sausage with any regularity either.
Great bbq and nice variety with a simple menu. The mac and cheese bowl with added meat is phenomenal. I will definitely be back

The food is awesome and the service was great. My only complaint is the price point. It was almost $40 for two of us to each get a one meat plate and bottled sodas. But the food was really good so I'm sure we will be back. And they have a loyalty program (quick app download and scan of the receipt) with something like after 10 plates the next is free, so that's cool. Cute decor, nice atmosphere, super friendly staff. Good local find!

Reasonably priced. Brisket was excellent! Both lean and fatty are offered. Sides were a little weak but overall a good experience

EDITED: Been here twice since this review was written. Mac and Cheese has improved to the point where I would recommend. Get a loaded baked potato with brisket and you won't be sorry. Her words not mine but both the collared greens and the deviled eggs were ruled excellent. Even the roll served with the 2 meat meal was tasty,

Good:  The pulled pork flavor and portion was excellent.

Neutral:  The three sauces were all very sweet.  If that is what you like, you will be set.

Bad: Portion size for the sausage link was ridiculously small.  Paying over $14 for a two meat plate and only getting one link was mid boggling.  Also, the coleslaw should have been stirred before dishing.  It was dry on top and overly drenched on the bottom.

I am somewhat of an amateur competition BBQ connoisseur and I just moved to Vegas for the winter from New York... I am so thankful to live close by to Billy's... I've had the ribs, pulled pork, brisket and pulled chicken so far and they have all been amazing.   I've been here 7 times in the three weeks since discovering it.   My only complaint is that they are closed on Sundays and I can't get my fix!  Truly exquisite BBQ.
Just isn't the same needs some tweaking. Consistency is very important with any food especially BBQ

Who ever expected legit BBQ in a random strip mall in Vegas burbs? They offer the full line of BBQ meats and sides here, it's a smaller place where you order at the counter and they bring out your meal. I had the combo brisket/pulled pork sandwich (sans slaw) and was impressed. The meat was well smoked, wasn't fatty, and they serve huge portions. Their BBQ sauces are okay but a little sweet for my taste since they don't have a mustard based option. I preferred to mix their smokier and vinegar sauces into my own custom blend. As for the sides, the BBQ beans are excellent with a smoky flavor and the fried okra is tasty as well. Service is really friendly as well. 

This place has excellent BBQ and you can't beat the prices. I'd come back here if i was in the area for sure.
The complete BBQ! Their ribs, pulled pork and chicken are very tasty.  Great selection of root beer. All the sides are great.

So I am in Las Vegas, I don't gamble and I don't drink.  What is left to do? Eat of course!  I come down with an acute desire for BBQ, but being from out of town, I am fearful of the unkown. There are few things worse than bad dry bbq. So Yelp to the rescue! Billy's pops up. Close, good reviews and only 2$$  so why not try. Great choice! Food is amazing.  Portion size very generous, moist and with good flavor. Bbq has a little more vinegar than most but still good. Best of all the bbq cravings are completely satisfied and I have lunch for tomorrow.
What happened. We went for dinner yesterday and the sign said closed for remodeling. Very disappointing! Is this restaurant going out of business??

Located just off the 215W and Flamingo (within Target parking lot, bascially next to The Vitamine Shoppe) is Billy's BBQ. Checked out reviews before heading here and pretty much everything is on point with Billy's.

The restaurant is order in or take out. Its a walk up style ordering system with a great squareup check out process that makes things easy or super easy if you have Apple Pay. 
Pretty much Brisket, Pulled Pork, Ribs, Sasuage, Sandwichs and many sides with a few deserts. Be sure to check out their online menu within yelp. 
As for pricing, seems to be consistent with Vegas BBQ and some other competitors with my rating at $$. 

I ordered the 2 Meal Combo which I choose Bristet and Pulled Pork, comes with 2 sides, mine were; sweet potato fries & baked beans and there famous Loaf of Bread. I also ordered 1/4 lb Ribs (dry). The Meats were certainly served in a good portion amount. Brisket was certainly good. Pulled Pork was dried out. Ribs were good with a little bit of fat. Sweet Potoates are just that and baked beans were good as well, not the best but good. The Loaf of Bread is pretty awesome, esp. if it just comes out of the oven.
If you dine in, your meal also comes with Peach Cobbler, which was pretty good as well. 

This is a Southern Style BBQ so it's a little different than the KC and Texas BBQ I am used to but was certainly good. The sauces offered were good, water in nature but just not my particular choice. Again, its more Southern Style.

The restaurant has standard fountain drinks and some speciality bottles to order with a bench style seating along one side of the wall and small 2 person tables thoughtout which can be moved together for more table seating. 
TV and Projection screen are noted.

They do offer All You CAN EAT - DINE IN ONLY. 

Services and staff was super. They were all very nice.

Man oh man, I'm from Texas and we do barbque, but this dude is killing.  We had been before and didn't eat cause everything was 86. So went late again and same thing but owner came out to apologies and gave us suggestions for what he had. So we got da brisket mac, dude!!! Da meat was so tender and moist but da mac n cheese should be illegal it's so good. Was stuffed and couldn't stop stuff in this stuff down. They were closing but before we left my wife placed an catering order for her company picnic.
Oh my.... By far the best BBQ west of Texas, and possibly the new king of Brisket! Melts in your mouth, no sauce required. Already planning on coming back next week. A MUST stop for your BBQ fix!
The food is great! The staff is super friendly, definitely will be back!! Although I'd love it more if they had burnt ends.

Went in at 7:15, left at 7:40pm, they seemed to not be very organized. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, tons of meat but only Luke warm and no BBQ sauce on the sandwich or given to me in my to go bag. The side I had was Mac and cheese which was bland and boring. This place reminds me of shitty Dickeys BBQ. Just another generic over priced BBQ place.

I was happily surprised with this small BBQ joint so close to home. Meat was delicious and tender. The Mac and cheese was small considering it was a large portion. Brisket beans were out of this world with a lot of meat in them. My last thought is that the sauces were runny though very tasty. Service was fast and friendly so I will definitely be back. Beats famous Dave's any day!

I never leave reviews but this place was the worst. I used to love it but I haven't been for a while until today. The portions have gotten ridiculously small whereas the prices have only increased. The best part was the cornbread which they no longer serve. It was a Friday night at 7 and the place was empty. This was absolutely the last time I will bother with this place.

Steamed vegetables are from frozen vegetables, not cool! Steam some fresh vegetables please, this is the least I can expect for my $20 dollar plate.

I know it's a BBQ place, the meats are pretty good. I would say it exceeded my exceptions from a strip mall place like this. I tried the brisket, pulled pork and sausage. Although everything was slightly on the colder side, they were all pretty good. The brisket is defeinitely better than Dave's bbq, which is right across the street. I think the sausage could use some more flavors, but not bad nevertheless. Service was also decent, nothing to complain.

What can I say?! Wowwww!! There is absolutely no reason to eat any other BBQ joint on this side of town! Chef Justin has taken the menu and the quality of BBQ to another level! The prices are better, quality insane and portions are enormous! 

They give you a choice of fatty or regular brisket! Why on earth wouldn't you do the fatty brisket, I did and it's the best I've ever had! The smoked Mac n Cheese, is exactly what the title says, perfectly smoked and creamy! Just lip smacking good! As for the Ribs, a full rack for 21.99 with 2 sides and cornbread is a steal and they blow away the competition if that's what you call the other places! Lol! 

Please support this place cause I only want to see it grow..!!!

This is the BBQ that dreams are made of, well my dreams anyways!  Wow!!!  The BRISKET was absolutely INCREDIBLE.  I'm a saucy kind of gal and even though this brisket didn't need any sauce, I loaded it up anyways and an even bigger WOW!!  Melt in your mouth brisket!!  My daughters ate the beans and said they were hands down the best beans they had ever eaten.  I haven't stopped dreaming of this place since I left!  Order a plate, moan in happiness and lick your fingers dry!!

Heard about Billy from some friends and decided to give them a try. Overall I really liked it, but it did have some negatives. 1) They had a very limited menu. 2) Many of the sides were crossed out (taken off the menu) and  3) only one dessert was offered, soft serve ice cream. That was a big disappointment as I can get soft serve at McDonald's. I would have loved some banana pudding or a slice of pie. 

I ordered the 2 meat mixed plate with ribs, brisket and 2 sides ($14.99). The ribs and brisket were delicious. I love that they use very little sauce, and you definitely don't need any. The ribs were fall off the bone tender and the brisket was juicy and flavorful. The BBQ brisket beans were also very good. Unfortunately the "smoked" mac & cheese was not good at all. The menu describes it as made with 6 cheeses but it was very dry and there was no smoke flavor at all. 

I did enjoy our lunch but not sure I would drive across town again just to go back. They need to add some more sides and desserts but the meats are the star here.

This review is based on the two times my girlfriend, my friend, mom, dad, and myself went here today, lunch and dinner.

First off the meat quality is phenomenal. I had the sampler plate for lunch and the 3 meat plate for dinner so i got to have a taste of all their meats. The smoke ring on the pulled pork, brisket, and ribs had such deep flavor. All the meats were super tender the ribs pulled away from the bone nicely (i dont like my ribs super fall of the bone which is a good sign a place boils them first). Another great sign this place way awesome is their chicken. Chicken sometimes can be dry and only flavored by being drenched in sauce. Billy's chicken is super moist and very well seasoned. I didn't find it necessary to use any sauce for their chicken infact it was gone before any of the other meats. A tip for their brisket, it comes in a lean and a fatty cut. I was not aware of this durring lunch and thought it was a bit fatty (still delicious ) but when i went back gor dinner the girl that took our order informed us and the lean cut was amazing! The Pulled pork just like the brisket and ribs were smokey and packed with flavor. I can imagine how awesome it would taste on a sandwich with coleslaw. Each meat was moist and flavorful enough i didn't really need the selction of sauces they had at each table (although their smokey sauce was fantastic!)

Now onto their sides: 
Pickle fries: really good! Fried perfectly and wonderful concept of making dill pickles into fries although i prefer cornmeal batter for fried pickles (ie BWW fried pickles) but these were really good!
Mac n cheese: delicious! Perfectly cooked spiral tube noodles in a super creamy cheese sauce.
Baked beans: wonderful sweet and smoked flavor with large chunks of their brisket mixed in. Very well seasoned and the brown sugar sweetness is a nice balance to all the smokey meats on my plate
Cornbread: just the right amount of sweetness and very moist.

Only cons i can think of is their soft serve ice cream was out and after all that meat some soft serve vanilla sounded amazing. So it was basically a tease lol. They also ran out of sausage by night time, but I'm not a fan of hot links (i did try them durring lunch and they were good but it's not something i would order no matter where i eat) also they dont have potato salad yet.

If i didn't have to cut weights for fights i would be at this place a couple times a week especially since i live down the street. All in all besides fancy appetizers and desserts this place beats Lucille's and Rollin Smoke for taste, quality, and convenience.  It wasn't  too packed (maybe because it's still pretty new) they had great combo selection ( 2,3, sampler meat plates) a few nice ala cart selections ( bbq mac n cheese bowl, gutbuster loaded waffle fries, sandwiches, bbq soft tacos,  etc) the service was really friendly too. I can see why the owner won those trophies they have on display above the drink fountains. 

I officially stamp this place RIDICULOUS APPROVED

Delicious addition to the west side!  Brisket & pulled pork were the favorites of the night. The pulled chicken tacos were also great!  Sampled a rib & it was finger lickin good!  The sausage was our least favorite item.  Billy came over to say hi & he is really passionate about this place & it shows.  Will def go back. You also get free soft serve ice cream!
My new favorite BBQ place! The pork tacos are amazing, and the service is great. Overall the place is very easy to find with plenty of parking. Super clean and friendly.

I found this place by visiting their tent at Bite of Las Vegas and the food hooked me. I'm a sucker for both their pulled pork and brisket. However, everything here is literally amazing. Anything you choose to eat won't disappoint. They're bacon Mac and cheese is also a personal favorite, mostly because their bacon is true bbq bacon and not the thin crap you get at restaurants. The place has a super cute aesthetic and decor, and most importantly super clean. Don't forget to try all of the sauces.
